Name: Bio-UV 2017: Photo(chemo)therapy in skin diseases
Description: In this study, the molecular mechanisms of action of photo(chemo)therapy in skin diseases are investigated. The diseases include psoriasis, cutaneous T-cell lymphoma, other lymphoproliferative disorders of the skin, eczema, lichen planus, rurigo/pruritus, polymorphic light eruption, mastocytosis, graft-versus-host disease, vitiligo and other photo(chemo)therapy-responsive diseases. Twenty patients are being enrolled per diagnosis group.
Sample Access Description: https://biobank.medunigraz.at/en/for-researchers/specimen-requests

Name: BioPersMed Cohort: cardiovascular and metabolic diseases
Description: This cohort comprises a huge number of samples and data collected since 2010 and is still ongoing. The aim is to detect biomarkers of patients at risk for cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. The BioPersMed cohort includes the areas: endocrinology & metabolism and cardiology. In the focus of this cohort: e.g. diabetes, fatty liver disease, osteoporosis, cardiovascular diseases. The biobank specimen comprise plasma, serum, buffy coat and urine stored at -80°C with 24/7 temperaturesurveillance, as well as the according clinical data including a large set of metabolic, cardiovascular, hormonal and general lab and imaging parameters.
Sample Access Description: https://biobank.medunigraz.at/en/for-researchers/specimen-requests

Name: Blood And Tissue Samples From Gynaecological Tumours / Gynaecological Cancers
Description: Blood as well as fresh frozen tissue samples have been collected from patients at the gynaecology department diagnosed with various gynaecological cancers.Collection strategy for blood samples and fresh frozen tissue: breast cancer, ovarial cancer, endometrial cancer, cervical cancer vulva and vaginal carcinomas rare gynaecological tumours endometriosis, LeiomyomasTime of collection: preoperative blood collection Tissue collection during surgery

Name: Blood Bank Collection: healthy subjects
Description: The sample collection of the Department of Blood Group Serology and Transfusion Medicine consists of plasma and cells from healthy male and female blood donors between 18 and 65 years.

Name: Blood and Tears: affective disorders, schizophrenic disorders, anxiety
Description: Blood Collection for future biomarker search projects combined with machine-based learning approaches helping to distinguish in between psychiatric diagnostic entities (e.g. Bipolar versus Unipolar Depression) and between disease states (e.g. manic versus euthymic).

Name: COVAC-DM Study: diabetes mellitus type 1, diabetes mellitus type 2, COVID-19, COVID-19 vaccine
Description: It is unknown, if people with established diabetes mellitus type 1 or type 2 display a reduced humoral immune response following COVID-19 vaccination as compared to people without this condition. In this study, we prospectively investigate antibody response in people with diabetes, following the first and second dose of vaccination (predominantly mRNA vaccine) as well as 12 months thereafter.

Name: COVID-19 Convalescent Cohort: SARS-CoV-2, COVID-19 recovered
Description: Biobank Graz is looking for COVID-19 recovered persons who are willing to donate blood on a voluntarily basis. The samples are used for diagnostic and prognostic biomarker identification, to get a better understanding of this severe disease and to develop different antibody-tests.

Name: Ability to collect COVID-19 cases
Description: Ability to prospectively collect COVID-19 cases for new research collaborations.

Name: Clinibil Study: post cardiac-surgery, ICU
Description: Biological samples were as part of the Clinibil study. This open, monocentric, observational study aims to investigate fluid and electrolyte balance in post cardiac-surgery patients staying in Intensive Care Unit (ICU).

Name: Colorectal Cancer (CRC) Whole Slide Image -  Clinical Annotation Cohort
Description: Inclusion criteria: Patients with colorectal cancer as a primary diagnosis (C18), samples from 1984 to 2013. Approx. 1800 whole slide images (resolution 0.25µm/pixel) from ~ 800 slides (H&E and IHC staining of FFPE tissue sections) from over 100 cases comprising tissue from colorectal cancer resections (tumour and non-tumour colon tissue, resection margins, fatty tissue, and associated lymph nodes)Associated data: Pathology diagnosis TNM staging ICD-10 and ICD-O codes Clinical data  Survival data Meta data from whole slide images

Name: Colorectal Cancer (CRC) Whole Slide Image - Survival Cohort
Description: Inclusion criteria: Patients with colorectal cancer as a primary diagnosis (C18), samples from 1984 to 2013.Over 180 000 images (resolution 0.25µm/pixel, over 800 TByte) from 100 000 slides (H&E and IHC staining of FFPE tissue sections) from over 6 400 cases comprising tissue from colorectal cancer resections (tumour and non-tumour colon tissue, resection margins, fatty tissue, and associated lymph nodes)Associated data: Pathology diagnosis TNM staging ICD-10 and ICD-O codes Survival data Meta data from whole slide images

Name: Colorectal Cancer (CRC) Whole Slide Image - Vascular Invasion Cohort
Description: Inclusion criteria: Patients with colorectal cancer as a primary diagnosis (C18), samples from 1984 to 2013. Approx. 800 whole slide images (resolution 0.25µm/pixel) from ~ 800 slides (H&E, histochemical and IHC staining of FFPE tissue sections) from over 260 cases comprising colorectal tumour tissue.Associated data: Pathology diagnosis TNM staging ICD-10 and ICD-O codes Clinical data  Survival data Meta data from whole slide images

Name: BAVL12 Tumor organoids: feasibility to predict sensitivity to treatment in cancer patients ﴾TUMOROID trial﴿
Description:
Purpose of the trial:
Tumor organoids are three‐dimensional cultures of cancer stem cells that can now be established on an individual patient basis. If tumor organoids are able to predict sensitivity to treatment, this can prevent unnecessary exposure to toxic agents and result in improved patient selection for treatment with targeted agents.

Primary objectives:
• Evaluate the potential of tumor organoid therapy response to predict treatment response in the patient
• Design a standardized organoid screening test and propose a test threshold that ensures a high negative predictive value

Primary endpoints:
• Area under the (partial) receiver operating characteristics (ROC) curve
• Optimal organoid screening test threshold and associated accuracy measures (sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value, negative predictive value)

Study design: This is a multicenter observational cohort study evaluating the feasibility of using tumor organoids as a screening tool to predict treatment response to standard of care agents in patients with metastatic colorectal or lung cancer. Patients will be asked to participate before they
start treatment with any kind of standard of care agent specified in this protocol. If patients consent to participation they will undergo a biopsy procedure of a metastatic lesion and a blood withdrawal before start of
treatment. The biopsy specimen will be used to culture tumor organoids, which will subsequently be incubated with the same standard of care treatment as has been given to the patient. In vivo and in vitro response will be compared to establish if it is feasible to use tumor organoids to predict response to treatment.

Name: BAVL13 Adaptive phase II randomized non-comparative trial of nivolumab after induction treatment in triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) patients: TONIC-trial
Description:
1.1 Background Triple negative breast cancer (TNBC) patients have a relatively high relapse rate and upon relapse the median overall survival is less than a year. [1-4] No targeted therapies are currently available for this subgroup. Compared to other breast cancer subtypes, the percentage of tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes (TILs) is significantly higher in TNBC. [5, 6] Given the durable responses induced by the immune checkpoint inhibitor nivolumab in other advanced solid cancers, immunotherapeutic approaches, such as blockade of PD-1 by nivolumab may be the key to treat TNBC. Moreover, since classical anticancer agents can stimulate immune effector cells [7-9], we hypothesize that short-term induction treatment with radiation, doxorubicin, cyclophosphamide or cisplatin induces an anticancer immune response resulting in synergistic activity with nivolumab.
1.2 Objectives and endpoints To determine the activity of nivolumab after four different immune response induction treatments in TNBC patients with metastatic disease. Primary endpoint: progression-free survival (PFS). Secondary endpoints: overall response rate (ORR), clinical benefit, overall survival, toxicity, immune-related toxicity.
1.3 Trial design This is a single center non-blinded randomized non-comparative phase II trial with an adaptive Simon two-stage design. [10] The first stage of the trial consists of five arms (4 with induction treatment followed by nivolumab, 1 with no induction treatment before nivolumab). For the second stage, the number of arms will be reduced based on the results obtained in the first stage.
1.4 Patient selection Metastatic TNBC with evaluable disease defined by RECIST 1.1 [11] and one or two previous lines of chemotherapy for metastatic disease.

Name: BAVL61 Biobank voor genetische biomarker analyse van weefsel/bloed van patiënten met een HPV-negatieve tumor in het hoofd-halsgebied.
Description:
Kanker in het hoofdhalsgebied, de keel, mondholte of het strottenhoofd is een zeer ernstige en levensbedreigende aandoening, zeker wanneer de tumor in een wat meer gevorderd stadium is. Er zijn twee geaccepteerde behandelingen voor een gevorderd stadium hoofdhalskanker: ofwel chirurgie met nabestraling, ofwel een combinatie van bestraling met of zonder gelijktijdige medicatie (radiosensitizer). Het zijn allebei ingrijpende behandelingen maar patiënten verkiezen toch vaak bestraling al dan niet met of zonder een radiosensitizer. Bijna de helft van de patiënten is niet genezen na bestraling in combinatie met een radiosensitizer. Die patiënten hadden naar verwachting beter behandeld kunnen worden met chirurgie en nabestraling, of post-operatieve chemoradiatie of een andere therapie. Helaas kunnen we niet voorspellen welke tumor goed reageert op radiotherapie met of zonder radiosensitizer. 

In dit project zoeken we daarom biomarkers op basis van genetische, pathologische en klinische factoren. Als op basis van biomarkers kan worden aangegeven dat er een grote kans is dat de tumor terug komt na bestraling met of zonder radiosensitizer, dan is de keuze voor een andere behandeling wellicht beter. Patiënten beslissen over de behandeling die ze ondergaan op advies van de behandelend arts. Helaas zijn er tot op heden weinig diagnostische mogelijkheden om subpopulaties met een slechtere response op de huidige standaard behandelingen te identificeren. Om deze reden is onderzoek naar tumorweefsel en bloed bij hoofd-halskanker patiënten van groot belang.


Patiënten met een advanced stage (III/IV) hpv-negatieve oropharynx, larynx en hypopharynx tumor die behandeld worden middels radiotherapie met of zonder combinatie van chemo of andere medicatie komen in aanmerkingen voor deze biobank. De biobank heeft als doel biomarkers te identificeren en valideren die de response op therapie kunnen voorspellen. Een exacte vraag is nog niet te formuleren aangezien het een deels exploratieve en validerende onderzoeksvraag betreft. Momenteel vinden retrospectieve analyses plaats welke met gegevens uit deze biobank dienen te worden gevalideerd. Inzameling van het weefsel komt overeen met de inzameling volgens het B15HHC protocol met inachtneming van de hierboven geformuleerde inclusiecriteria. 
Kortgezegd, alle patiënten die voldoen aan de inclusiecriteria die komen voor een eerste afspraak op de poli Hoofd & Hals Oncologie & Chirurgie krijgen de informatiebrief over het verzamelen van weefsel voor een biobank. De arts-assistenten/nurse practitioner/fellows/hoofd-hals chirurgen geven deze brief. Indien de patiënt heeft besloten weefsel af te staan, wordt het ic-formulier gescand en komt het in het elektronisch patiëntendossier. Op de operatiedag moet de hoofd-halschirurg in Chipsoft controleren of het ic-formulier getekend is ja/nee (gaat de patiënt akkoord met het verzamelen van de biopten). Indien mogelijk worden er 2 biopten tumor vries, 2 biopten tumor paraffine en 2 biopten normaal weefsel  afgenomen. Er is een oranje HHC pathologie Research formulier vervaardigd door Dr. Lotje Zuur voor op de operatiekamer en hierop wordt aangegeven welke weefselsamples verzameld zijn voor welke studie/biobank. Het weefsel en oranje formulier worden na de operatie opgehaald en ingeleverd bij de afdeling pathologie. Aan het weefsel wordt een code gekoppeld en met behulp van deze code is het weefsel terug te vinden. De code van het weefsel is gekoppeld aan de betreffende TRION code (B17GEN). Het afnemen van 1 extra buis bloed zal plaatsvinden tijdens de standaard bloedafname voor het stellen van de diagnose/ opstellen van het behandelplan. Voor het afnemen van 1 extra buis bloed geldt een verwijzing naar het reeds bestaande en goedgekeurde protocol P09BIO.
Samples zullen zoveel mogelijk in een batch verwerkt worden om zo batcheffecten te voorkomen. De FFPE biopten zullen worden verwerkt voor DNA en Fresh-frozen materiaal voor RNA en DNA next-generation sequencing. Het bloed zal hierbij fungeren als controle voor het DNA mutatiepatroon. Het normaal weefsel zal fungeren als controle voor het RNA expressie patroon. Het paraffine materiaal zal worden gebruikt voor immunohistochemie.

Name: BAVL72 CONventional TReatment Or Leave DCIS
Description:
Since  the population-based breast cancer screening was introduced in the Netherlands in 1989, the incidence of Ductal Carcinoma In Situ (DCIS) of the breast has increased more than sixfold. DCIS is considered a precursor of invasive breast cancer and mostly treated as such, with surgery and, in case of breast conserving surgery, radiotherapy. Despite the increased incidence of DCIS, the incidence of invasive breast cancer has not declined. This implies that DCIS does not always progress into invasive carcinoma, resulting in overtreatment of at least part of patients diagnosed with screen-detected DCIS. To test this hypothesis, a randomized, international multicenter, open-label, phase III non-inferiority trial was set up by Elshoff et al (LORD-trial), and has recently started including women. The LORD-trial will compare standard treatment with active surveillance in 1240 women aged ⩾ 45 years with asymptomatic, screen-detected, pure low-grade DCIS based on vacuum-assisted biopsies of calcifications only. Both study arms will be monitored with annual digital mammography for a period of 10 years. The primary end-point is 10-year ipsilateral invasive breast cancer free percentage. Currently, the LORD-trial is open for inclusion in eight Dutch centers and more are to open  in the coming months. In addition, multiple centers in different European countries will start accrual within the next year 
As expected, not all women want to be randomized and not all women are randomized to the study arm of their personal preference. As a consequence, a minority of women (estimated about 25% as outlined in the statistics section of the LORD-trial protocol) decide to undergo either conventional treatment or active surveillance rather than participate in the randomized study. To avoid loss of crucial information from these women regarding their perceptions and reasons for their individual choices, to collect and analyze their tissue samples and to monitor their follow-up, it is essential that these women give consent to participate in the proposed prospective observational study. For this study, identical inclusion criteria apply as for the LORD-trial. 
The potential study participant will be offered at participation in the LORD-trial. If the patient does not want to participate in the trial due to a strong preference for one of the study arms, the patient will be offered the alternative non-randomized observational study.
In conclusion, the aim is to utilize highly important data complementary to the LORD-trial, crucial to evaluate and improve the management of low grade DCIS.

Name: Hartwig Medical Foundation
Description:
Unique dataset for research into better cancer treatment
Hartwig Medical Foundation established the first national genomic database for cancer research in 2015. The Foundation is also responsible for the management of this database. The first data was made available to researchers in 2017.
The database combines genetic and clinical data (including treatment outcomes) of patients in the Netherlands with metastatic cancer. The database continues to grow with the addition of data from about 100 new patients every month. The genetic data are generated using Whole Genome Sequencing (WGS), making this unique database the most comprehensive source of data in the world for research into cancer and better treatments of this disease.
Purpose of the database: to find new biomarkers
The genomic database is helping researchers to improve their understanding of cancer. This requires large quantities of data in order to recognize patterns in the disease. This is also how biomarkers are discovered, by identifying the links between genetic mutations, tumor characteristics, drugs and treatment outcome. Hartwig Medical Foundation systematically generates genetic data and collects clinical data and makes these data available to physicians, practitioners and researchers, so that new biomarkers can be discovered faster and existing biomarkers can be improved. In addition to the discovery of new biomarkers, the information can also be used to improve the effectiveness of existing treatments.

Name: HCV Research UK
Description: HCV Research UK is a UK-wide consortium established in 2011 to underpin research into hepatitis C (HCV).  This was achieved by establishing a biorepository and clinical research database. The biorepository is housed in the MRC-University of Glasgow Centre for Virus Research, directed by Dr John McLauchlan and managed by Dr Sarah McDonald. Samples have been obtained from around 10,000 patients.    Access to samples and data is governed by a Tissue and Data Access Committee (TDAC). These are reviewed for ethical and scientific merit by TDAC and a decision reached.     Serum and plasma are obtained from all patients in the cohort. Buffy coats are also collected, and DNA can be extracted when required. Additionally, peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) and PAXgene tubes are held for smaller cohorts of patients. The extensive clinical data collected complements the biorepository and allows selection of samples from patients with characteristics of interest.    Sub-cohorts:  • Serial samples from patients who were treated as part of the NHS England Early Access Program.  • Yearly samples from cirrhotic patients (beginning 2015)  • Spontaneous resolvers  • Small paediatric cohort    Clinical Data  • Basic demographics incl place of birth and ethnicity  • History of HCV infection including exposure to risk factors and dates  • Date of diagnosis, date of first attendance at clinic  • Co-morbidites and co-medications at time of enrolment  • Liver disease status and how diagnosed  • Treatment status at enrolment;   • Social history including alcohol, cigarettes, cannabis; BMI  • HCV RNA status, viral load and genotype/subtype  • Historical data from the patients' notes regarding previous treatment episodes (dates, regimen, viral loads, outcome) and liver biopsies  • Laboratory data including imaging and fibroscan;  • New treatment episodes and changes in liver disease status are recorded over time, as are any newly developed co-morbidities.    All data generated by researchers who access our biorepository must be returned into the database. Over time this will include host genetics, full length viral sequences, immunophenotyping and biomarker studies.

Name: Improved Prognosis of Vascular cognitive impairment using automatic quantitative imaging biomarker extraction and disease modelling
Description: The project uses two multicentre cohorts retrospectively: the CVON Heart Brain Connection (HBC) study and the Trace-VCI study. The main hypothesis motivating this collection is that improved insights into the association between imaging markers of vascular brain disease and specific pathways involved in cognitive decline will pave the way towards improved diagnosis and prognosis of VCI. We obtain conventional brain imaging biomarkers and manual labels for the baseline dataset (N=566) and the 2-year follow-up (N=349) of the HBC data. This included visual analysis by neuroradiologist, manual infarct segmentation, automatic global/lobar/regional volume quantification, ASL analysis, phase-contrast MRA flow analysis. For Trace-VCI this was already available. In addition, for using both cohorts, we developed and validated novel methods for automated quantification of microbleeds, enlarged perivascular spaces and lacunar infarcts.

Name: Gestational diabetes mellitus cohort / Obstetrics diabetes mellitus cohort
Description: The aim of this study was to collect blood samples from pregnant women diagnosed with diabetes receiving obstetric care at the Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology at the University Hospital Graz. Gestational diabetes is a condition in which a woman without diabetes develops high blood sugar levels during pregnancy. GMD accounts for approx. 90% cases of diabetes mellitus in pregnancy, while preexisting type 2 diabetes accounts for less than 10% of such cases. This retrospective cohort (5 years of collection - from 2015 until 2019) may be used to address various research questions in the field of obstetrics and diabetes research.

Name: Graz Diabetes Registry for Biomarker Research
Description: The aim of the Graz Diabetes Registry for Biomarker Research (GIRO) is to collect a representative cohort of people with diabetes mellitus, obesity undergoing bariatric surgery or with a lipid metabolism disorder who are treated in the Outpatient Clinic for Diabetes, Lipids and Metabolic Diseases of the University Hospital Graz and are willing to provide biobank samples stored at the Biobank Graz. For all participants comprehensive clinical data is available.

Name: HBO Post-Covid: ongoing Covid-19, long Covid-19, hyperbaric oxygen
Description: Opportunistic and exploratory pilot study in patients with ongoing or long Covid-19, respectively. Hypothesis: Breaching of chronic inflammatory reaction by cyclic hyperbaric oxygenation (HBO) using 10 sessions (one each working day) at 2,2 ata at a duration of 75 minutes is possible. Besides measurements of oxygen saturation, tissue oxygen tension, spirometry, blood pressure and heart rate, neurological status and subjective assessment by questionnaire and VAS-scale laboratory parameters will be assessed before and after the treatment cycle as well as after 3 months. Samples will be collected from 100 patients at 3 visits (2400 aliquots).

Name: HCM Register: hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, HCM, biomarkers, cardiac amyloidosis
Description: Blood samples as well as urine samples have been collected at the department of cardiology from patients diagnosed with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM).
Sample Access Description: https://biobank.medunigraz.at/en/for-researchers/specimen-requests

Name: Intermittent Fasting Cohort Study: alternate day fasting, intermittent fasting, healthy subjects
Description: Intermittent fasting is a dietary regimen by alternating fasting and “feeding” cycles. In addition to caloric restriction only, intermittent fasting seems to activate cell autophagy which potentially increases cellular stress resistance and removes accumulated molecules that are potentially toxic. This cohort study with embedded pilot randomized control-trial investigates the effects of repeating fasting periods in healthy subjects on human physiology, aging process and molecular-cellular processes in humans. We will be able to study long term effects (subjects, who already practise ADF for a defined time period) and short term effects (subjects randomized to the ADF group) of this nutritional intervention.

Name: KIWI Collection: fertility treatment, reproductive medicine, in vitro fertilisation
Description: In this project samples of patients receiving fertility treament in terms of assisted reproductive technologies are collected and stored at the Biobank Graz under standardized circumstances. The collection comprises samples of blood serum, follicular fluid, cumulus cells, embryo culture supernatant and seminal plasma. The aim of the study is to establish a database of infertile couples to facilitate scientific approaches to improve the success of fertility treatments.

Name: LBI Lung Vascular Research Pulmonary Vascular Collection: pulmonary hypertension
Description: In cooperation with the Ludwig Boltzmann Institute for Lung Vascular Research (LBI-LVR), blood samples, lung tissues from transplanted patients as well as primary cell lines (fibroblasts and smooth muscle cells) have been collected from patients with pulmonary hypertension (PH) or at risk for PH and stored at the biobank.

Name: MRT Brain Cohort: specific areas and lesions of human brains
Description: Specific areas and lesions of human brains have been collected from deceased persons. Based on images obtained by magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) the samples were collected.All collected brain sections - including lesions - were anatomically identified, coded and then preserved in the biobank. For each individual, frozen tissue is available from 50 defined (coded) regions of the brain.The PIs of the MRT brain collection are interested in research collaborations from the following disciplines: Neuropathology Expression analysis Laser dissection Mass spectrometry Proteomics ELMI

Name: Med Uni Graz Cell Lines: fibroblasts, keratinocytes, melanocytes, sacral chordoma, clival chordoma, melanoma, sarcoma,  cholangiocarcinoma
Description: In vitro experiments in different cell systems can reduce and replace animal testing. In any case, in vitro testing provides the basis for animal testing in line with the 3R principle. CellBank Graz supplies researchers with human and animal cell lines that comply with a high quality standard.Cell lines are also established as required and characterized in detail.Non-tumorigenic cell lines:Human juvenile fibroblastsHuman adult dermal fibroblastsHuman juvenile keratinocytesMUG Lucifer iHDF immortalized human dermal fibroblastsHuman juvenile melanocytesHuman adult dermal melanocytesChordoma cell lines:MUG-Chor1: Human sacral chordomaMUG CC1: Human clival chordomaMelanoma cell lines:MUG Mel 2: Human NRAS mutant melanomaMUG Mel 3: Human BRAF melanoma from a pregnant patientSarcoma cell lines:MUG CiDus: Human CIC-DUX 4 sarcomaMUG Lucifer: Human clear cell sarcomaMUG Lucifer metastasis: Human clear cell sarcoma lung metastasisMUG Myx2: Human myxofibrosarcomaCholangiocarcinoma cell lines:MUG CCArly 1: Human cholangiocarcinoma/Klatskin tumor

Name: Myeloid Neoplasias Collection: acute myeloid leukemia (AML), myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS), chronic myelomonocytic leukemia (CMML), myeloproliferative neoplasias (MPN)
Description: High-quality specimens of myeloid neoplasias (MN) with a specific focus on acute myeloid leukemia (AML). Specimens are derived from either bone marrow or peripheral blood, enriched for mononuclear cells and stored in DMSO in liquid nitrogen thus enabling various analytical and functional experiments including patient-derived xenografts. Specimens are usually obtained at diagnosis, remission or refractory disease, and relapse. Clinical and genetic/NGS data as well as information about therapeutic regimens administered are available for each sample.

Name: Neurology Collection: neurodegeneration, neuroinflammation, controls, lumbar puncture, cerebrospinal fluid, serum, biomarkers
Description: Focus on neuroimmunological and neurodegenerative disorders. Large control sample collection, including:Inflammatory neurological disease controls (INDCs)Peripheral inflammatory neurological disease controls - (PINDCs)Non-inflammatory neurological disease controls (NINDCs)Symptomatic controls (SCs)

Name: Neurosurgery Collection: cancer, operation on intervertebral discs, epilepsy
Description: Blood as well as tissue samples have been collected from patients admitted at the clinical department of Neurosurgery. The subjects comprise patients with cancer, operated on the intervertebral discs or with epilepsy.

Name: Oncology Collection: Cancer/ Tumours in breast, digestive organs, male genital organs, urinary organs, respiratory system and intrathoracic organs...
Description: Blood samples have been collected from patients diagnosed with cancer at the oncology department. At the moment more than 560.000 aliquots collected from about 13.000 patients are stored at Biobank Graz.The distribution of the malignant neoplasms reflects the frequency of malignant neoplasms at the university hospital / in the Styrian population.

Name: Orthopaedics Collection: arthrosis, coxarthrosis , gonarthrosis, bone sarcoma,   bone tumour, soft tissue tumour, soft tissue sarcoma
Description: This collection includes samples of serum, plasma, buffy coat, frozen tissue and their corresponding data. Started in the year 2010 the collection is still ongoing. The diagnoses are various orthopaedic diseases especially arthropathies, malignant and benign neoplasm. The collection comprises more than 6.000 patients with more than 60.000 samples.

Name: PERFORM: Febrile illness, any type of infection, children and adolescents without fever and infection (healthy)
Description: Personalised Risk assessment in Febrile illness to Optimise Real-life Management across the European Union.

Name: Photo-responsive Diseases:  psoriasis, eczema, cutaneous T-cell lymphoma, vitiligo, graft-versus-host disease, mast cell diseases and other conditions
Description: This cohort collection was initiated to determine predictive biomarkers (cytokines/chemokines, SNP’s) in photo-responsive such as psoriasis, eczema, cutaneous T-cell lymphoma (CTCL), vitiligo, graft-versus-host disease (GvHD), mast cell diseases and other conditions. Biologic samples are available from baseline visit, i.e., at start of treatment with photo(chemo)therapy.

Name: Tissue Biobank Morphological Laboratory of Gynecology/ Histology
Placenta and Cord Blood Collection: control group, group with pregnancy disorders, diabetes, intrauterine growth retardation, preeclampsia, preterm delivery
Description: Fresh frozen placental tissue, umbilical cord blood (venous and arterial) as well as maternal blood samples have been collected from pregnant women at the time of delivery.The sample donors comprise a control group as well as a group with pregnancy disorders, such as diabetes, IUGR or preeclampsia, as well as preterm delivery.The sample collection at the Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology followed a standard operating procedure (SOP).

Name: PoCOsteo Study: osteoporosis, osteoporotic fracture, metabolic bone disease, healthy
Description: Blood samples are collected, an extensive clinical history is taken and bone mineral density is measured at study entry and after 12 months (and optionally after 24 months), in a cohort of patients referred to the osteoporosis clinic of the Division of Endocrinology and Diabetology (Department of Internal Medicine). Thus, a wide range of samples will be available, literally from women and men who are healthy per definition, to patients who suffer from multiple diseases associated with osteoporosis and/or osteoporotic fractures. Accordingly, samples may originate from women and men who do not receive any pharmaceutical treatment as well as from patients who are treated with several medications, including those registered for treatment of osteoporosis.

Name: Pregnancy Hypertension Cohort: gestational hypertension
Description: Blood samples have been collected from pregnant patients suffering from hypertension.

Name: Probiotic dietary Intervention in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome – A Randomized Controlled Trial (ProPCO-RCT): PCOS, probiotics, metformin, RCT, testosterone
Description: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS) is a condition characterized by increased male sex hormones, irregular menstrual cycles, infertility, obesity, diabetes and other symptoms and complications. It is usually treated with lifestyle changes, hormonal contraceptives ("the pill") or with metformin, an antidiabetic drug.We want to assess the possibility of treating PCOS with probiotics, as gut bacteria are known to affect hormonal and metabolic functions. For that purpose, we designed this 6-month intervention trial, in which 60 women per group ingest either a probiotic, a placebo or metformin. In the end hormones, sugar metabolism and other PCOS criteria are evaluated.

Name: Psoriasis
Description: This sample collection consists of serum, plasma, buffy coat and PAXGene samples from patients with the diagnosis psoriasis.

Name: ROC-HF Cohort: Role of Comorbidities in Heart Failure
Description: ROC-HF is a cohort study in which more than 200 patients with optimally treated chronic heart failure were included over a period of approx. 2 years. The study aims to describe previously neglected comorbidities in chronic heart failure with regard to their prevalence and relevance for disease progression. These include in particular disorders of bone metabolism, resulting osteoporosis and vertebral body fractures but also changes in central and peripheral hemodynamic.

Name: Radiotherapy Collection: cancer patients (primarily prostate, breast, lung and rectal cancer)
Description: The sample collection of the Department of Therapeutic Radiology and Oncology consists of plasma and cells from male and female cancer patients (primarily prostate, breast, lung and rectal cancer) aged ≥ 18 years obtained prior to the start of radiotherapy.

Name: STEMI-Lipids Study: ST-elevation myocardial infarction
Description: The main aim of this prospective, observational study is to investigate lipid and inflammatory markers in the acute phase of 85 ST-elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI) patients and 3-months thereafter at the University Hospital of Graz.

Name: Sepsis Collection
Description: This collection includes serum samples from patients diagnosed with sepsis evaluated according to the Sepsis-related organ failure assessment score (SOFA).

Name: Testicular Cancer Cohort: testicular cancer, stage I, diagnostic tumor markers
Description: Patients with stage I germ cell tumors are relapsing in up to 30 to 50 percent of cases. Therefore, the discovery of novel biomarkers may predict the relapse early, help to detect metastases, and may be helpful in improving the outcome of these patients. The aim of this cohort study is to discover novel diagnostic biomarkers and to validate the value of miR-371 in detecting relapse in stage I germ cell cancer patients.

Name: The CoVVacBoost Study - COVID-19 booster vaccination
Description: The aim of this study is to evaluate the ability of a COVID-19 booster vaccine to induce a salivaryantibody response and to investigate a possible correlation with the serum antibody response andthe cellular response. A quantitative and functional comparison of the salivary anti-SARS-CoV-2antibody response before and after 3rd booster vaccination will be investigated. Volunteers, who gettheir 3rd vaccination at the “Impfstraße” at the LKH-Univ. Klinikum Graz are asked to participate in thisstudy. Blood and saliva samples will be obtained during 3 visits.Visit 1 (before the 3rd booster vaccination): Serology, PBMCs, salivaVisit 2 (3 – 8 weeks after the 3rd booster vaccination): Serology, PBMCs, salivaVisit 3: 6 months after the 3rd booster vaccination: Serology, salivaThe following data are collected for all participants: type of COVID-19 vaccinations, medical history(including immunosuppressive therapies, chronic graft versus host disease, severe opportunisticinfections, prior vaccination history (types, titers if available), current and past disease includingCOVID-19), current medication, BMI, smoking habits

Name: The CoVVac Study: COVID-19 vaccination, immunocompromised, healthy, t-cell aging, t-cell immunity, humoral and cellular immune response
Description: This study will characterize and analyse the anti-SARS-CoV-2 humoral and cellular immune response before and after vaccination with a focus on the anti-spike protein response in immunocompromised patients compared to healthy controls. The cohort study includes 189 adult participants with primary or secondary immunodeficiencies (suffering from haematological and rheumatic diseases) and 187 healthy control subjects.Blood and saliva samples will be obtained before (visit 1) and after (visit 3-6) vaccinations.Visit 1(60-0 days before vaccination): Serology, immune status, t-cell immunity, t-cell agingVisit 2 (0-14 days after first vaccination): Telephone visit to get information on vaccination reactionsVisit 3 (+21-28 days after 2nd vaccination): Serology, t-cell immunity, nutritive assessment, body fat compositionVisit 4 (+6 months after 2nd vaccination): SerologyVisit 5 (+3-6 weeks after V4 or 3rd vaccination): Serology, t-cell immunityVisit 6 (+6 months after Visit 4): Serology, t-cell immunity,nutritive assessment, body fat compositionDate and type of COVID-19 vaccinations, medical history (including immunosuppressivetherapies, chronic GvHD, severe opportunistic infections, prior vaccination history (types, titers ifavailable), current and past disease including COVID-19), current medication, BMI, smokinghabits, and nutritive assessment will be obtained for all participants.

Name: Thorax IL-6 Sepsis Marker Cohort: biomarker, SIRS, sepsis
Description: This prospective, clinical, single-center study aimed to evaluate the feasibility of interleukin 6 as a predictive biomarker in the early diagnosis of postoperative systemic inflammatory response syndrome after a major thoracic surgery. The enrolled subjects underwent either lung resection or esophageal operation.

Name: Vitamin D3 in Thoracic Surgery Cohort: cancer patients, vitamin D deficiency
Description: Blood and tissue samples were collected from patients participating to the “Vitamin D3 in Thoracic Surgery” clinical trial. This double blind randomized prospective, placebo-controlled study aims to determine the 25(OH)Vitamin D -levels in the patient collective admitted for general thoracic surgery, and to initiate substitution therapy in case of Vitamin D deficiency. The secondary objective is to assess the further course of the abovementioned collective.

Name: Vitamin D Hypertension Cohort: cardiovascular risk factors
Description: Biological samples from the Styrian Vitamine D Hypertension Trial have been collected. This single-center, double-blind, placebo-controlled study aims to evaluate whether vitamin D supplementation affects 24-hour systolic ambulatory blood pressure monitoring values and cardiovascular risk factors.
Sample Access Description: https://biobank.medunigraz.at/en/for-researchers/specimen-requests

Name: LEAD
Description: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is an important cause of morbidity and mortality worldwide and has a tremendous impact on the individual patient, the healthcare system, and the general public. Contrary to other chronic diseases, the natural history of COPD, commonly described as the natural decline of lung function, has not been investigated sufficiently. Understanding normal lung development and ageing, both in health and disease, and in men and women, is considered a research priority in current respiratory medicine and is essential to properly interpret results of eventual therapeutic interventions. , Therefore, we intend to asses a) the age-related natural decline in lung functions in the general population, b) the prevalence of COPD and the development of major respiratory symptoms in this disease, c) the prevalence of the most important COPD comorbidities (eg. cardiovascular, metabolic and cognitive dysfunction) and d) the association between the natural decline of lung function and socioeconomic status, individual long term exposure to air pollution and other toxic inhalants and comorbidities. , To our knowledge this health examination survey will be the first investigation in Austria providing information about the most prevalent respiratory disease worldwide, its comorbidities and underlying causal factors in a longitudinal approach.
Sample Access Description: Decision consensually made by PI and Biobank

Name: Fructose and NAFLD
Description: Fructose overconsumption is linked to non-alcoholic fatty liver disease and impaired lipid and glucose metabolism which is also associated with increased risk for cardiovascular disease (CVD). Since bile acids (BA) are critical regulators of lipid and energy metabolism, we aimed to explore whether dietary fructose challenge (FC, 150g/day for 4 weeks) may impact on lipid and glucose dysbalance by changing BA metabolism. Further, we aimed to assess the impact of the high oral fructose challenge on hepatic lipid metabolism reflected by total hepatic lipid content (HLC), fatty acid saturation and phosphorous metabolites (PM, indicating hepatic energy metabolism), and glucose homeostasis. Moreover, we aimed to explore the role of LPA as potential biomarker predicting hepatic sensibility to fructose induced (lipo)toxicity. Finally, in animal models fructose overconsumption leads to chronic metabolic low-grade inflammation and was also linked to cardiovascular disease (CVD) as well as development of type-II-Diabetes (T2DM). Until now, the impact of fructose overconsumption is often studied in overweight, T2DM or NAFLD patients, but is not as well described in healthy subjects. To test our hypothesis that fructose overconsumption may impact on the gut-liver axis by increasing intestinal permeability, bacterial translocation, and consecutively metabolic inflammation as important mechanisms in the pathogenesis of NAFLD, CVD and T2DM, we examined the impact of a high oral fructose challenge on intestinal permeability and inflammation.
Sample Access Description: Decision consensually made by PI and Biobank

Description: The purpose of this clinical trial is to investigate the impact of moderately elevated blood bilirubin levels on health. A moderately elevated bilirubin level should be associated with a lower risk of cardiovascular disease and could have a protective effect against damage to the genome.

Name: Vienna Bleeding Study (molecularbiological)
Description: Blood coagulation disorders are diseases of the hemostatic system, which have a common symptom of bleeding tendency. The plasmatic coagulation disorders hemophilia A and B as well as the Willebrand syndrome are the most common and therefore the most studied changes. They occur both as a congenital as well as acquired disease. In addition, there are other congenital or acquired disorders that require treatment. These include thrombocytic and hyperfibrinolytic coagulation disorders as well as decreased concentration or activity of various other plasmatic coagulation factors., The aim of the present study is to evaluate the influence of molecular biological changes and their functional effects in congenital blood clotting disorders.
Sample Access Description: Decision consensually made by PI and Biobank

Name: Biobank of outpatient clinic for Echinococcosis
Description: Human echinococcosis is a parasitic disease of species of the genus Echinococcus, which have mostly found their main host in Canidae. In Austria, the disease is considered the most significant endemic parasitosis., The purpose of this study is to generate a prospective cohort of all patients with suspected or diagnosed echinococcosis and to establish a biobank in which to store biological material from these patients.

Name: NAFLD - PNPLA3 Study
Description: In this study 81 non cirrhotic patients are stratified according to PNPLA3 genotypes (27 patients per group, CC,CG,GG). All patients receive a protein shake therapy (HEPAFAST) for 2 weeks and instructions to follow a low glycemic and insulinemic (LOGI) diet for another 6 weeks (EOT). All patients are seen longitudinally for four time points (baseline, week 2, 2 months and 6 months-follow up). At each time point liver fat content is assessed by an independent/blinded investigator with Fibroscan CAP. Additionally Fatty Liver Index (FLI), waist circumference (WC), BMI, HbA1c, triglycerides (TG) and GGT are analyzed.

Sample Access Description: Decision consensually made by PI and Biobank

Biobank colorectal tumors
Description: Examination of tumor samples and plasma and serum proteins and their prognostic relevance on long-term survival in patients with colorectal tumors.
Sample Access Description: Decision consensually made by PI and Biobank

Name: Prospective registry of patients with coronary heart disease
Description: The purpose of this clinical trial is to collect clinical data from patients with coronary heart disease (CHD). CHD is a progressive disease of the world's highest-rate coronary heart disease. This data could help us to better predict the course of the disease in the future and to better control the therapy. This study is the creation of a future biobank registry for patients with CHD.
Sample Access Description: Decision consensually made by PI and Biobank

Gestational diabetes
Description: The primary goal of this study is the systematic creation of a biobank of patients suffering from gestational diabetes. The archived samples should contribute to the study of new diagnostic and therapeutic strategies for this pregnancy-associated disease.
Sample Access Description: Decision consensually made by PI and Biobank

Name: Learning by Moving
Description: The overall aim of the Learning by Moving study is to investigate the effects of two types of physical activity on cardiovascular fitness, gross motor skills, cognitive functions, academic achievement, brain structure, and brain fucntioning in 8-10-year-old typically developing children. Furthermore, relateions between the physical and cognitive domain will be investigated.
Biobank Label: UMCG Cohort and Biobank Coordination hub

Name: Adipositas
Description: The primary aim of this study is the systematic creation of a biobank with patients suffering from morbid obesity. The archived samples should contribute to the study of the pathogenesis and the relevant factors of this disease.
Sample Access Description: Decision consensually made by PI and Biobank

Name: BORTEJECT
Description: The biobank study BORTEJECT is divided into a screening phase and a clinic. examination to evaluate the effect of bortezumib on graft survival in renal transplant recipients.
Sample Access Description: Decision consensually made by PI and Biobank

Name: Circulating miRNA in oral plate Ca
Description: The purpose of this clinical research project is the diagnosis (detection) of malignant tumors of the oral cavity - especially oral squamous cell carcinoma - with regard to the occurrence of recurrences (recurrence of the disease) or early diagnosis (detection at a very early stage ) to improve.
Sample Access Description: Decision consensually made by PI and Biobank

Name: Circulating miRNA in oral plate Ca - PAXGene RNA
Immune thrombocytopenia collection
Description: The aim of the study is to identify predictive factors for the clinical course in patients with primary ITP (immune thrombocytopenia). Two groups of patients should be included in the study for this purpose: i) newly diagnosed patients with primary ITP, ii) patients with known primary ITP with and without ongoing treatment.
Sample Access Description: Decision consensually made by PI and Biobank

Name: SUN Study
Description: The SUN study is a Bio repository of 6 monthly sequential blood samples from 350 men with Prostate Cancer  - pre-treatment and through follow-up

Name: InCreAS
Description: Acute kidney injury (AKI) is an infrequent but major and well - recognized complication of cardiac surgery. In this study the investigators want to test if increased baseline Serum Creatinine is influenced by body composition.  Furthermore the investigators want to evaluate several novel biomarkers for AKI on their predictive effect in cardiac surgical patients.
Sample Access Description: Decision consensually made by PI and Biobank

Name: Prospective registry of patients after myocardial infarction
Description: The aims of this prospective register are to investigate different types of AMI (acute myocardial infarction, STEMI  & NSTEMI) and patient response to different treatments.

Within the framework of ViBiMeD, bioprobes of patients with musculoskeletal diseases treated at the University Clinic for Orthopedics of the Medical University of Vienna are to be collected, processed and archived for relevant study purposes.

Name: CRC Brussel Diabetes Biobank
Description: The Diabetes Biobank Brussels (DBB) is associated with the Belgian Diabetes Registry, a nationwide clinical network of more than 200 diabetologists and researchers from more than 100 clinical centers, comprising the vast majority of universitary and conventioned departments of endocrinology and pediatrics in Belgium. Since 1989, the network has collected more than 100,000 questionnaires with standardized clinical information and blood samples from: > 10,000 recent-onset diabetes patients aged 0-39 years at diagnosis (all types, predominantly type 1 diabetes in that age category) > 10,000 of their first-degree relatives aged 0-39 years

Name: Tumorbank UZ Brussel
Description: The Tumorbank UZ Brussel is part of The Belgian Virtual Tumourbank, a Belgian consortium of 11 hospitals, among which all major Belgian university hospitals. We collect tumor samples and associated human tissues (normal tissue, blood, urine,...) in several collection methods (frozen, paraffin,...).

Name: Biobank Antwerpen
Description: Biobank Antwerpen is an academic university hospital integrated biobank. Historically this biobank originated from Biobank@UZA which was a tumourbank. Nowadays, it's a collaboration between the University Hospital of Antwerp (UZA) and the University of Antwerp (UAntwerpen). Biobank Antwerpen is also the partner for many other research institutions and companies working with human body material. It contains a broad sample collection, harbouring samples of all active research domains at the university and the hospital. Examples are samples from oncology, pediatrics, immunology, microbiology, neurology etc. Biobank Antwerpen provides samples for all kind of research projects, both academic as (non)-commercial.

Name: BBCVA
Description: This Biobank is a research biobank created to better understand the physiopathology of arterial diseases e.g. atherosclerosis, fistulas and aneurysms.

Name: Biobanque du Centre des Thérapies Expérimentales (CTE-BBO)
Description: The CTE-BBO was created with the following scientific goal(s): to support care and research missions, and to preserve patient samples for possible immunotherapy treatment (under the seal of a specific study consent)

Name: Biobanque CURML Sudden cardiac death
Description: In this biobank are stored samples from SCD cases. Sudden cardiac death (SCD) is a major public health problem. The underlying cause of SCD is most frequently coronary atherosclerotic disease in elderly victims, while genetically determined cardiomyopathies, such as hypertrophic, arrhythmogenic, or canalopathies prevail in young people. In case of potential genetic origin of cardiac pathologies, pathologists are then involved in a multidisciplinary investigation on surviving family members. The role of the pathologist is to perform an autopsy, to diagnose the case, to keep post-mortem samples according to legal and ethical guidelines and upon request, to orient relatives of SCD’s victims to a genetic counselling.

Name: Biobank Brain Tumor Research (BB_031_BBLBGT)
Description: The Brain Tumor Biobank - BB_031_BBLBGT - collects tissues, blood (plasma & PBMC), and CSF from patients operated in the service of Neurosurgery at the CHUV that become available for use in research. The aim of the BB is to provide the research material to evaluate clinical and biological aspects of tumor development and malignant progression of brain tumors. These comprise investigations of  molecular mechanisms relevant for the clinical course of the disease,  response to therapy, or search for  new treatment approaches, and including interactions with the tumor microenvironment and immune system.

Name: OptiSurg
Description: Nutrition et chirurgie vasculaire

Name: Brain
Description: Cohort study

Name: Research biobank on the indesirable effects of psychotropic drugs
Description: The biobank is constituted of blood, urine and stool samples, clinical and genetic data from donors involved in research projects on the adverse effects of psychotropic drugs.

Name: BB-URS
Description: The BB-URS aims to collect biological samples and genetic data of psychiatric patients and healthy controls that are recruited in research projects conducted by the URS team or in collaboration with national and international partners.

Name: Urology Biobank
Description: The Urology Biobank is dedicated to the collection of samples from urological cancer patients for the research projects of the Urology Research Unit and scientific collaborations.

Name: Dermatology Biobank
Description: The scope of the Dermatology Biobank is to conduct research in the field of dermatology and venereology. It includes especially skin tissue and PBMC from patients and study volunteers from the Dermatology Service of CHUV.

Name: Pathologie Forensique
Description: At CURML (University Center of Legal Medicine of Romand Switzerland), approximately 500 autopsies are performed every year upon the request of the judicial authority. A collection of body fluids and tissues, including blood, urine and adipose tissue, are routinely collected, analyzed, and conserved for legal purposes. This biological material included into the Research Biobank “Pathologie Forensique” of the CURML after three years from the collection, and is available for scientific research projects.

Name: CK-CARE biobank
Description: CK-CARE ist owner of the biobank. Davos BioSciences AG hosts and operates their biobank and is a sister company or in other words afflilate of the same parent company as CK-CARE (called Medizin Campus Davos AG)

Name: Microbiome_IEM
Description: Sampling of biological material to characterise microbiota in children with inborn errors of metabolism

Name: Microbiome_NEC
Description: Sampling of biological material to characterise the change in microbiota over time in children with risk of necrotzising enterocolitis and late-onset sepsis and their healthy family members.

Name: Biobanque Génomique du CHUV
Description:
Réservoir d'échantillons biologiques et de données cliniques des patients du CHUV, la BGC est une ressource de premier ordre pour la médecine génomique.
La BGC est une biobanque hospitalière Suisse créée par le CHUV et l'UNIL en 2013. L'objectif de cette biobanque est de contribuer à la découverte de nouvelles thérapies et de mesures préventives en offrant aux chercheurs un accès sécuritaire et dépersonnalisé aux données et échantillons de qualité.
Une prise de sang pour la BGC peut être réalisée chez tout patient du CHUV qui signe le consentement général. Le plasma isolé du sang total et l’ADN extrait des cellules sont mis à disposition des chercheurs pour de futures analyses.

Name: Covid-19 Ticino Biobank
Description: This COVID-19 Ticino Biobank was established to a unified Swiss web-based cohort for prospective high-quality baseline and follow-up data registration of COVID-19 patients hospitalized, according to standardized directives. This Biobank will provide a platform for carrying out scientific research projects on COVID-19 and allows collaborations with reference networks to elucidate clinical presentation, natural history, response to treatment, immune response and cytokines activation, and outcomes of the disease.

Name: Swiss Autoimmune Liver Disease
Description: The aim of the present registry with its biobank is to collect high quality prospective data and biosamples on rare diseases in order to elucidate epidemiology, natural history, response to treatment and outcome. In addition, the biobank allows addressing specific scientific issues on a variety of open questions. The registry will provide a platform for carrying out scientific research projects on AILD. In addition, the registry will allow collaborations with reference networks on AIH, PBS and PSC abroad.

Name: SCREEN-RA:  a Swiss cohort study of first-degree relatives of rheumatoid arthritis patients
Description: The SCREEN-RA biobank: Blood samples were routinely collected from healthy first-degree relatives of patients with RA (RA-FDR), known to have an increased risk of developing RA as compared to the general population .Since 2010, over 1500 FDR-RA across Switzerland have enrolled. Blood samples are routinely sampled for serum, genomic DNA and total RNA collection. In a subset, stool samples and oral examinations are also performed for microbiota assessment.

Name: AneuX - Intracranial Aneurysm Domes Biobank
Description: Human intracranial aneurysm domes obtained during microsurgery by resection of the aneurysm dome after clipping of the neck. All samples are collected at the Neurosurgery division of the Geneva University Hospitals.

Name: BaHOP
Description: BaHOP houses a disease-focused biobank. It is a liquid, human, public owned biobank established to promote research to improve prevention, diagnosis, and therapy in the field of oncology, hematology, and immunology on pediatrics diseases.

Name: Geneva Brain Bank
Description: The  Geneva Brain Bank collects tissues since 1926. It contains today more than 10'000 formalin-fixed human autopsy brains with clinical documentation, neuropathological diagnoses, the corresponding paraffin-embedded tissue blocks (often from whole brains slices), several thousand histological slides and several hundred frozen tissue blocks.

Name: Geneva Brain Tumor Biobank
Description: The Geneva brain tumor biobank is a public biobank from the oncology department of the HUG. Samples collected include brain tissue, brain cyst and cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) from adult and pediatric patients with brain tumors or non-tumor brain lesions, tumor and biopsy samples from adult cancer patients, as well as blood and serum samples from adult cancer patients and healthy individuals. A subset of these samples is collected with corresponding detailed clinical documentation. These samples can be passed on to third parties for research purposes.

Name: ICOVAX
Description: Paxgene tubes (for RNA) and RNA, serum, plasma and PBMC from donors before and after vaccination.

Name: Familial Hypercholesterolemia biobank (FH)
Description: The FH biobank contains DNA from index case with a clinical phenotype of familial hypercholesterolemia (Dutch Lipid Clinic Network score of 6 or more), as well as their relatives. After extraction from EDTA blood tube, DNA is stored at -80°C.
Biobank Label: Institut Central des Hôpitaux de Sion

Name: PINIT
Description: We are collecting samples from sick and healthy children from the area Immunology, Infectiology and Stem Cell Transplantation. We collect left overs and extra material.

Name: Swiss Pediatric Haematology and Oncology Biobank Network
Description: The SPHO Biobank Network stores samples received from Centers of the Swiss Paediatric Oncology Group (SPOG), in collaboration with Tissue Banks of Swiss Pathology Institutes. Donors to the Biobank are patients suffering from oncological diseases, benign hematologic diseases, undergoing hematopoietic stem cell transplantation for any indications or individuals related to pediatric diseases (for example, family members of donors).

Name: Liquid Biobank Bern
Description:
The Liquid Biobank Bern (LBB) consists of an institutional collection of patients from the Inselspital, Bern University Hospital. Blood samples (Plasma, Serum, DNA) of patients of the Inselspital including the clinical patient data are collected and stored for the future use of research projects.

A high sample quality suitable for omics analysis is achieved by fast track (~1h from needle to freeze), an highly automated and standardized processing, and storage in fully automated robotic stores (at -80°C and N2) by the state-of-the-art infrastructure of the Inselspital, operated by the Center for Laboratory Medicine. The samples are tightly tracked by their barcodes and each time-point (from blood draw to storage) is set by robots/scanners to grant a high data quality.  

The samples are collected specifically for this biobank (no leftover material) to achieve this controlled, standardized fast track processing. This hospital cohort was initiated by the Inselspital to facilitate biomedical research by supplying samples of high quality. The goal is to improve prediction, prevention, diagnosis and therapy in human medicine. With the collected samples and data, underlying mechanisms of diseases can be researched.
Biobank Label: Liquid Biobank Bern Infrastructure - Biobank Services

Name: SHeS-Bern Pilot Phase Biobank
Description: The SHeS-Bern Pilot Phase biobank is part of the human biomonitoring pilot project (Swiss Health Study Pilot phase: SHeS Pilot phase). This population-based cohort has been launched by the Federal Office of Public Health (FOPH) in Switzerland to prepare the implementation of a future national program. The aim is to identify health and exposure indicators, which are central to the understanding and monitoring of health and disease in the general population. The biobank includes biological material together with a large amount of data (health examinations, questionnaires).
Biobank Label: Liquid Biobank Bern Infrastructure - Biobank Services

Name: SHeS-Vaud Pilot Phase Biobank
Description: The SHeS-Unisanté Pilot Phase biobank is part of the human biomonitoring pilot project (Swiss Health Study Pilot phase: SHeS Pilot phase). This population-based cohort has been launched by the Federal Office of Public Health (FOPH) in Switzerland to prepare the implementation of a future national program. The aim is to identify health and exposure indicators, which are central to the understanding and monitoring of health and disease in the general population. The biobank includes biological material together with a large amount of data (health examinations, questionnaires).
Biobank Label: Liquid Biobank Bern Infrastructure - Biobank Services

Name: Swiss Center for Musculoskeletal Biobanking (Biobank)
Description:
The SCMB Platform serves as a national reference center for the collection, storage and analysis of tissue and blood samples donated by patients with musculoskeletal conditions. Patient consent is ensured and recorded electronically. In addition, the SCMB platform supports research groups and projects, for example, with analysis, interpretation of results, participation in projects, or the acquisition of research funds.
The SCMB is created to bridge the gap between doctors and scientific researchers to improve the prevention, diagnosis and treatment of specific musculoskeletal diseases (tendon disease, muscle atrophy, osteosarcoma).

Name: Bioledger
Description: Patient-specific organoids starting with gastro-intestinal organoids of healthy and Cystic Fibrosis patients.

Name: Swiss Spinal Cord Injury Cohort Study
Description: The SwiSCI biobank will provide a platform for testing scientific and medical hypothesis and work in a synergy with the Swiss Spinal Cord Injury Cohort Study (SwiSCI). As an epidemiological study, SwiSCI will provide major assets for biobanking: a nation-wide and representative study population; prospective lifetime follow up of participants; potential for genetic and metabolic association studies comparing SCI to the general population; and a data model facilitating international collaborative research.
Data Access Description: Collaboration-based , Cost sharing between participating institutions on a project based approach.
Image Access Description: Collaboration-based , Cost sharing between participating institutions on a project based approach.

Name: PFZ-UKBB - Biobank
Description: This biobank governs the use and the access to samples collected as left-over material from clinical routine and left-over of reserach projects.

Name: Serum and plasma samples with C22 diagnosis
Description: Biobank at the Department of Immunochemistry Diagnostics, University Hospital Pilsen collects and stores human liquid samples (plasma, serum) and related clinical data of oncological patients.  We focus on long term storage repository. The main diagnoses of this subcollection is liver cancer. All blood samples are collected at the time of diagnosis prior to the surgery or any other kind of treatment. Two aliquots of serum and two aliquots of plasma samples at the volume of 350 ml are stored at -80°C. Comprehensive clinical data are available through the hospital infromation system.
Biobank Label: Bank of Biological Material, Charles University - Pilsen

Name: NGN_LEARN
Description: This is a birth cohort biobank that includes a collection of samples to study the mechanisms underlying the association between early nutrition and infant neurodevelopment. The biobank aims to support the storage of biological specimens from the longitudinal LEARN birth cohort study that enrols newborn infants and their parents in the large Zurich Area between 2022 and 2024.

Name: Biobank of the Swiss HIV Cohort Study
Description: The biobank of the Swiss HIV Cohort Study contains viable blood mononuclear cells (once per calendar year per patient), plasma samples (at least once per calendar year per patients) and purified DNA for the majority of patients.

Name: Tissue Biobank USZ
Description: As integrative part of the Department of Pathology and Molecular Pathology, University Hospital Zurich, the Tissue Biobank USZ manages formalin-fixed, frozen and live cell samples and information from patients of the USZ and other hospitals according to the guidelines of the Human Research Act (HFG) and international guidelines.

Name: FABER cohort
Description: Describe the reproductive health of young Swiss men in relation to geographic variation and evaluate the association between semen quality and environmental/ lifestyle factors to which men were exposed to in-utero and during adulthood.

Name: NeuroDev and Disease Biobank
Description: The NeuroDev and Disease Biobank has been created for the storage of different biological materials for research purposes in order to study neurological disorders and the emergence of neurodevelopmental diseases.

Name: Biobank Pathology at USB
Description: The Pathology Department at the USB operates a biobank called "Biobank Pathology UniSpital Basel" (hereinafter BPUSB) for an indefinite period in conjunction with the clinics of the USB. Samples (tissues and bodily fluids) and patients' information are included in the biobank for use in the context of diagnosis / treatment as well as in ongoing and future diagnostic quality assurance that has yet to be determined. The BPUSB also keeps biological material for current and future test developments and research projects. The biobank has been financed until now by the Pathology Department of the USB and will continue to be for the time being.

Name: MATAO Clinical Trial biobank
Description: The biobank hosts the samples collected for the MATAO- MAintenance Therapy with Aromatase inhibitor in epithelial Ovarian cancer: a randomized double-blinded placebo-controlled multi-center phase III Trial including LOGOS (LOw Grade Ovarian cancer Sub-study) (ENGOT-ov54/Swiss-GO-2).

Name: Swiss Transplant Cohort Study Biobank
Description: A multicenter biobanking system to harvest, store and deliver DNA, plasma and live PBMC samples taken just before, at 6 months and 12 months after solid organ and hematopoietic stem cell transplant, for research related to transplantation. Centers: Universitätsspital Basel (USB), Universitätsspital Insel Bern, Hôpitaux Universitaire de Genève (HUG), Centre Hospitalier Universitaire Vaudois (CHUV), Kantonsspital St. Gallen, Universitätsspital Zürich (USZ). Www.stcs.ch.

Name: Tissue Biobank Bern
Description: The Tissue Bank Bern manages samples and information from patients of the Inselspital and other hospitals in the catchment area of the Institute of Pathology, University of Bern, according to the guidelines of the Human Research Act (HFG) and international guidelines.

Name: VetSuisse Biobank, VET_GEN_BERN

Name: FFPE blocks Collection
Description: We collect and archive FFPE blocks from various neoplasms as well as broad spectrum of non-neoplastic conditions and also normal tissues. Virtually all organ systems are included. The blocks are archived for at least 20 years.
Biobank Label: Bank of Biological Material, Charles University - Hradec Králové

Name: Main collection of HK biobank
Description:
We collect frozen tumor tissue from following neoplasms: breast cancer (C50), colonic cancer (C18-C20), head and neck cancer (in particular; pharyngeal and laryngeal cancer) (C01, C09, C32), borderline tumors of ovary (D39), ovarian cancer (C56), and hepatocellular carcinoma (C22). Paraffin blocks are also available.

Sbíráme nativní vzorky nádorové tkáně u následujících diagnóz: karcinom prsu, kolorektální karcinom, karcinomy oblasti hlavy a krku (zejména karcinomy hltanu a hrtanu), borderline tumory ovaria a karcinomy ovaria, hepatocelulární karcinom. Současně jsou k dispozici parafinové bločky s nádorovou tkání.
Biobank Label: Bank of Biological Material, Charles University - Hradec Králové

Name: Main collection
Description: Main collection comprising all the samples: aliquots of DNA, serum and plasma, subsamples of frozen tissue and tissue in RNALater from particularly pathological tissue (oncology) are stored. It comprises 4,300 retrivals, 2,850 tissue samples, 3,683 blood samples, 534 urine samples, which makes up approximately 80,000 subsamples and aliquots.
Biobank Label: Bank of Biological Material of the First Faculty of Medicine of Charles University, Prague

Name: Serum and plasma samples of the Pilsen biobank
Description: Biobank at the Department of Immunochemistry Diagnostics, University Hospital Pilsen collects and stores human liquid samples (plasma, serum) and related clinical data of oncological patients.  We focus on long term storage repository. The main diagnoses of interest are: breast cancer, colorectal cancer and prostate cancer. All blood samples are collected at the time of diagnosis prior to the surgery or any other kind of treatment. Two aliquots of serum and two aliquots of plasma samples at the volume of 350 ml are stored at -80°C. Comprehensive clinical data are available through the hospital infromation system.
Biobank Label: Bank of Biological Material, Charles University - Pilsen

Name: MeninGene
Description: Ongoing nationwide prospective cohort study in 90 hospitals since March 2006; coverage of 95% of all Dutch adults with community-acquired bacterial meningitis. Extensive clinical database, DNA, CSF, and causative bacteria; brains of diseased patients; including controls matched for age, ethnicity, socio-economic status, and bacterial exposure.

Name: Lungenbiobank Heidelberg
Description: Thoracic Diseases

Name: Main collection of UPOL biobank
Description:
We are freezing native samples of cancer tissues and lymph nodes from the pholooing diagnoses: colorectal carcinoma, lung carcinoma, glioma, prostate carcinoma. Material is also processed into FFPE blocks. We archive isolated DNA from colorectal carcinoma, glioma, and melanoms obtained from FFPE blocks and/or plasma. DNA isolation is implemented considering CEN/TS 16835-3,16835-2, 16827-3, but external audit has not been implemented nor the certification was pursued.

Czech version: Zamražujeme nativní vzorky nádorové tkáně a uzlin u následujících diagnóz: kolorektální karcinom, karcinom plic, gliomy, karcinom postaty. Současně jsou k dispozici parafinové bločky s nádorovou tkání. Archivujeme izolovanou DNA kolorektálního karcinomu, karcinomu plic, gliomů a melanomů získanou z FFPE bločků anebo z krevní plazmy.
Izolace DNA se provádí s ohledem na normy CEN/TS 16835-3,16835-2, 16827-3, ale externi audit nebyl proveden a o certifikaci nebylo žádáno.
Biobank Label: Bank of Biological Material, Palacký University

Name: Isolated DNA collection of UPOL biobank
Description: Sub-collection of the UPOL biobanks containing isolated DNA. We archive isolated DNA from colorectal carcinoma, glioma, and melanoms obtained from FFPE blocks and/or plasma. DNA isolation is implemented considering CEN/TS 16835-3,16835-2, 16827-3, but external audit has not been implemented nor the certification was pursued.
Biobank Label: Bank of Biological Material, Palacký University

Name: Cryo-preserved collection of UPOL biobank
Description: Sub-collection of the UPOL biobanks containing cryo-preserved biological material and related FFPE blocks. We are freezing native samples of cancer tissues and lymph nodes from the pholooing diagnoses: colorectal carcinoma, lung carcinoma, glioma, prostate carcinoma. Material is also processed into FFPE blocks.
Biobank Label: Bank of Biological Material, Palacký University

Name: Main collection of Asklepios Biobank für Lungenerkrankungen
Description: Es ist das Ziel der Biobank, Gewebe, Blut und andere Körperflüssigkeiten in hoher Qualität zu sammeln, zu lagern und für die wissenschaftliche Forschung zur Verfügung zu stellen. Sie ist Teil des „Comprehensive Pneumology Centers München“ (CPC-M) und Mitglied im Deutschen Zentrum für Lungenforschung (DZL), einer vom Bundesministerium für Bildung und Forschung unterstützten Einrichtung, die sich die weitere Erforschung und die Entwicklung neuer Therapieverfahren von und für Lungenerkrankungen zum Ziel gemacht hat. Als Teil dieser Bemühungen sind in der Plattform Biobanking im DZL Biobanken an den verschiedenen Standorten, u.a. auch in Gauting, etabliert.

Name: Main collection BioBank Bonn
Description: Die BioBank Bonn ist eine Serviceeinrichtung der Medizinischen Fakultät der Universität Bonn. Aufgabe der Biobank ist es, klinisch-translationale Forschung sowie Grundlagenforschung, z.B. zur Entwicklung diagnostischer, prognostischer und prädiktiver Biomarker für bestimmte Erkrankungen zu ermöglichen und zu unterstützen. Hierzu werden Biomaterialien und deren Derivate, die von Forschern gesammelt wurden, in der Biobank Bonn eingelagert und die dazu gehörigen Daten und Metadaten in einer Datenbank gespeichert.

Name: Dresden Integrated Liquid Biobank
Description: The DILB is a central liquid biobank in which only liquid biomaterials are processed automatically. They are kept in fully automatic nitrogen storage systems. The DILB is affiliated to the Institute for Clinical Chemistry and Laboratory Medicine (IKL).

Name: Tumour and Normal Tissue Bank
Description: TNTB is a central tissue biobank in which mainly solid tumor tissue is stored. It is affiliated to the Institute of Pathology and certified according to DIN EN ISO 9001:2008.

Name: BBM collection frozen tissue
Description: Tumor and matching non-tumorous tissues samples collected at the University Medical Center Mainz since 2016.

Name: Biobank of the German Multiple Sclerosis Competence network
Description: Biobank of the National German MS cohort
Biobank Label: Biobank der Neurologie des Klinikum rechts der Isar der TU München

Name: Bioprobensammlung der Klinikum-Lippe GmbH
Description: Probes saved according the NAPKON protocol

Name: IFamily study - 2nd follow-up of IDEFICS
Description: IFamily is the 2nd follow-up study of the european cohort study IDEFICS (Identification and prevention of Dietary- and lifestyle-induced health EFfects In Children and infantS) with biosamples from adolescents and their families.
Biobank Label: Biobank des Leibniz Instituts für Präventionsforschung und Epidemiologie - BIPS

Name: ARCAGE (Alcohol-related cancers and genetic susceptibility in Europe)
Description: German collection of the european multicenter study ARCAGE (Alcohol-related cancers and genetic susceptibility in Europe) with 292 cases of XXX Mund-Rachen-Larynx cancer and 328 controls.

Name: HodenTumor Studie
Description: HTS is a study on the aetiology of testicular tumors in workers of the motor vehicle industry.

Name: IDEFICS/IFamily - European study on diet and lifestyle in children including two follow-ups
Description: Biosamples from an epidemiological longitudinal cohort study on dietary- and lifestyle-induced health effects in children and infants with two follow-ups into adolescents, including biosamples from family members of eight european countries.
Biobank Label: Biobank des Leibniz Instituts für Präventionsforschung und Epidemiologie - BIPS

Description: Biosamples from the baseline survey of the cohort study IDEFICS (Identification and prevention of Dietary- and lifestyle-induced health EFfects In Children and infantS) from eight european countries.
Biobank Label: Biobank des Leibniz Instituts für Präventionsforschung und Epidemiologie - BIPS

Name: IDEFICS study  - 1st follow-up
Description: Biosamples from the 1st follow-up of the cohort study IDEFICS (Identification and prevention of Dietary- and lifestyle-induced health EFfects In Children and infantS) from eight european countries.
Biobank Label: Biobank des Leibniz Instituts für Präventionsforschung und Epidemiologie - BIPS

Samples from patients with Major depressive disorder, bipolar disorder and schizophrenia and healthy probands with/without a genetic risk for AD or with/without an enviromental risk 
Serum, plasma, PBMC, Urine, stool, oral swab, saliva, whole Blood EDTA, stimlated whole blood supernatant (LPS, Anti CD3- anti-CD28), hair, PAXgene
Sample Access Description: Samples are available in coopertaion with the Clinic for Psychiatry
Data Access Description: according to the user information on www.cbbmr.de

Description:
Module 1 "Tumor" - Tissue and liquid samples and living biobank from patients of the Marburg University Hospital, Biobank of Anneliese Pohl CCC Marburg and UCT-MR Center for Excellence in Onkology

Sample Access Description: After consultation with PI of the project
