Description: Tissue collection uro-genital cancer
Sample Access Description: Application for use via the Use & Access Committee of the University Hospital Erlangen

Name: HSC donor and HSC recipient specimen and data
Description: Collection of DNA from recipients and donors in context of hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSC)

Name: Resource with Liquid Biospecimens and Image Data
Acronym: Resource with Liquid Biospecimens and Image Data
Description: All liquid biospecimens with associated clinical data and image data come from DZHK-funded studies that are obtained using standardized procedures at all study centers via the DZHK's research platform. As a result, our resource is growing steadily.
Sample Access Description: To create and submit applications for use of data and/or biospecimens, please visit https://dzhk.de/en/dzhk-heart-bank/submitting-applications/.
Data Access Description: To create and submit applications for use of data and/or biospecimens, please visit https://dzhk.de/en/dzhk-heart-bank/submitting-applications/.
Image Access Description: To create and submit applications for use of data and/or biospecimens, please visit https://dzhk.de/en/dzhk-heart-bank/submitting-applications/.

Name: DZHKomics Resource
Description: This control resource was generated from around 1,200 healthy people. It serves as a basis of comparison for the more precise determination of differences between healthy and sick people - not only for cardiovascular research. Approximately 1,150 whole genome sequences consist of SNVs, Indels and approx. 48 million variants. In addition, there are RNA sequence data from around 700 test persons. Corresponding basic phenotypes are also available.

Name: EHEC-HUS
Description: At Medical Clinic I, serum and blood from all EHEC/HUS patients at the clinic were prospectively collected during the EHEC outbreak in Germany in early summer 2011. The samples were collected at diagnosis and then every three months thereafter. EHEC: Enterohaemorrhagic Escherichia coli. HUS: hemolytic-uremic syndrome.
Biobank Label: Biobank der Medizinischen Klinik I, Universitätsklinikum Hamburg-Eppendorf

Name: Fever without source
Description: The Bernhard Nocht Institute for Tropical Medicine collects samples of various materials from febrile, inpatially and healthy children aged 0-15 years in Ghana. Clinical and partly socio-economic data are collected additionally. Throat swabs and blood were taken from healthy children. Depending on the symptom complex, the following samples were taken from the sick children: blood, urine, stool, cerebrospinal fluid, throat swab. All samples undergo extensive diagnostics.

Name: Main collection of GCKD-Biobank, comprising of all the samples.
Description: The German Chronic Kidney Disease (GCKD) study represents a prospective observational national cohort study of patients with CKD in Germany. The main specific aims of the study are (i) to identify and validate risk factors and markers associated with the progression of CKD and the development of end stage renal disease (ESRD), (ii) to identify and validate risk factors and markers associated with cardiovascular disease (CVD) events and CVD progression in the setting of CKD. Central storage of high quality biomaterials is a central component of the study concept to allow establishing associations between biomarkers, patient characteristics and outcomes. The GCKD Study has established a network that combines a central coordinating center in Erlangen with nine regional centers at collaborating academic institutions (Aachen, Berlin, Erlangen, Freiburg, Hannover, Heidelberg, Jena, München and Würzburg). The GCKD-Study is governed by a Steering Committee which is formed by representatives of the coordinating center, each regional center and cooperating institutes. Six members from the Steering Committee have been elected to the Executive Publication Committee to review proposed publications according to the publication policy and to an Ancillary Studies Committee to channel and harmonize ancillary study proposals according to the ancillary studies policy. The GCKD Steering committee must take all decisions about biomaterial utilization. Members of the study consortium can request biomaterials; application forms and processes for evaluation are in place. Biomaterials have already been shared with sites in Germany, Switzerland and the US

Name: Collection TX-Kohorte München
Description: The DZIF Transplant Cohort is unique in Germany and aims to help improve treatment of patients who have already received a donor organ or had a stem cell transplant.

Name: Collection Airway coloniztion ad CF Hannover
Description: Pseudomonas aeruginosa (PsA) is a hallmark pathogen of the lung disease in cystic fibrosis (CF) patients. Chronic PsA colonization is a central factor in the course of CF lung disease. PsA contributes considerably to morbidity and mortality, and also has a significant impact on quality of life and the costs of CF treatment.

Description:

serous or endometrioid ovarian, tubal or p
Ri

-

Tin-

-
To be considered as maintenance therapy

"

Name: Collection CF-Register Hannover
Description: Improved results in paediatric liver transplantation have gradually shifted focus of clinical research from increasing patient survival to enhancement of long-term quality of life. One of the major challenges today is to optimise immunosuppression post transplantation in order to reduce drug toxicity and infection, whilst maintaining adequate immunosuppression to prevent rejection and graft loss. One of the difficulties in achieving this goal lies in understanding the functional level of therapeutic immunosuppression.

Name: COVID 19 Biobank MWK
Description:
Aufbau einer Covid-19 Sammlung:
Covid-19 Patienten (750):
Patienten über 18 Jahre mit Symptomen einer SARS-CoV-2 Infektion (auch wenn der diagnostische SARS-CoV-2 Nachweis  noch aussteht) mit folgenden Schweregraden:
COVID+ schwer (Intensivstation)
COVID+ mittel    (stationär)
COVID+ leicht    (nicht stationär)
COVID+ symptomfrei
Kontrollgruppe (250):
Patienten mit anderen respiratorischen Erkrankungen (SARS-CoV-2 negativ) über 18 Jahre

Name: Collection Digit HF Hannover
Description: DIGIT HF is a study for the therapy of cardiac insufficiency, which is funded by the german Federal Ministry of Education and Research (BMBF). The aim is to examine whether the active substance digoxin, which increases the contraction force of the heart, can prolong the life of patients with a certain form of cardiac insufficiency and reduce their hospital stays. Digitoxin belongs to the group of digitalis preparations that can be used - originally from the thimble - for selected patients for the treatment of cardiac insufficiency or cardiac arrhythmia.

Name: Collection HBV-Cure Hannover
Description: Chronic hepatitis B virus infection has not yet been cured. A control of viral replication with inhibitors of the reverse transcriptase (nucleoside analogues) is possible in over 90%. However, nucleoside analogues have only a very small influence on the cccDNA, the HBV template in the cell nucleus of the liver cell. Therefore, the main goal of the overarching DZIF project is to find new concepts to achieve the goal of "HBV Cure".

Name: Collection Human Genetics Hannover
Description: Samples of patients from the routine of human genetics counseling.

Name: Collection Human Genetics-Chromosome Instability Hannover
Description: Our goal is to elucidate mechanisms of chromosomal instability in MDS and in hematological stem cells. We are investigating the connections of the origin of CIN more closely.

Name: Collection Human Genetics-Tumor Hannover
Description: Samples from patients from the routine of human genetics Tumour counselling.

Name: Collection HIB MH01 Psychiatrie Tourette
Description:
The Project is part of the MHH-HIB collection.
Patient collective:
inclusion criteria:
- Patients with chronic primary tic disorders (chronic motor tic disorder, chronic vocal tic disorder, Tourette Syndrome)
- secondary tic disorder
- temporary tic disorder

Name: Collection HIB MH02 Pneumologie Asthma
Description:
The Project is part of the MHH-HIB collection. 
Patient collective: Patients with severe bronchial asthma of various origins (allergic or intrinsic). 
Inclusion criteria: 
-  Eosinophilia (>300 Eosniophile / ml blood) 
- Therapeutic option Administration of anti IL-5 antibody (exhausted conventional therapy (LABA, LAMA, high dosis of  ICS +/- oral steroid therapy)). 
Longitudinal sampeling will be conducted before and during the anti IL-5 antibody therapy respectively.

Name: Collection HIB MH03 Kardiologie Kardiomyopathie
Description:
The project is part of the MHH-HIB collection. The blood samples will be obtained in context of a comprehensive cardiomyopathy registry, which is currently being established at the MHH. Patients will be observed over several years and repeated collection of blood samples during the follow up is planed. 

Patient collective: 
Inclusion criteria: 
- Dilated cardiomyopathy 
- noncompaction cardiomyopathy 
- inflammatory cardiomyopathy 
- metabolic cardiomyopathy 
- secondary cardiomyopathy (toxic infiltrative storage diseases) 
- restrictive cardiomyopathy 

Exclusion criteria: 
- Ischemic heart disease as an underlying disease 
- Heart valve diseases as an underlying disease 
- Congenital heart defects 
- Primary pulmonary arterial Hypertension 
- hypertensive cardiac disease

Name: Collection HIB MH11 Nephrologie
Description: Samples from the polyclinic of nephrology for hypertension patients.

Name: Collection HIB MH05 Nuklearmedizin Prostatakarzinom
Description:
The Projekt is part of the MHH-HIB collection.
Patient collective:
Patients with advanced, castration-refractory prostate cancer who will undergo a new molecular-directed radionuclide therapy(PSMA-ligand-therapy)targeting the prostate-specific membrane Antigen. Patients will be treated every 8 weeks and extensive laboratory chemistry, imaging and clinical characterization will be carried out every 8 - 16 weeks. Blood samples will be colected before the first therapy and at 3 timepoints after a Treatment cycle.

Inclusion criteria:
- Patients with advanced, castration-refractory prostate cancer with progress under guideline-compliant androgen blockade and progress under chemotherapy
-Extensive characterization using a standardized panel of laboratory Parameters (blood count, extensive clinical chemistry, PSA, testosterone)
- Extensive characterization of whole-body tumor burden and its heterogeneity by means of molecular Imaging (PET/CT)
- Characterization of renal function using laboratory parameters and kidney scintigraphy (clearance)

exclusion criteria:
- Lack of PSMA expression of the metastases (PET/CT)
- restricted bone marrow reserve
- Higher grade kidney failure
- ECOG > 2
- Life expectancy < 3 month

Name: Collection HIB MH06 Gastroenterologie Autoimmunhepatitis
Description: This Project is part of the HIB collection. Samples from patients with autoimmun hepatitis. The projekt is also part of the KFO250

Name: Collection HIB MH07 Kardiologie Herzinsuffizienz
Description:
The Project is part of the MHH-HIB collection
Patient collective: Patients with symptomatic heart failure who are included in the use case cardiolog in the HIGHmed project.
For all patients a defined dataset will be collected. The data will be analyzed by medical informatics techniques to identify patients with high risk for hospitalization caused by worsening of heart failure. After identification of These patients, the patients will be intensively monitored to prevent future hospitalization. The biosamples will be collected to perform advanced scientific studies to identify new disease mechanisms

Name: Collection HIB MH08 Kardiologie Endokarditis
Description: The Project is part of the MHH-HIB collection. The applicant plans to establish a endocarditis register in cooperation with the Klinik for nuclear medicine and other cliniks of the MHH. Nearly all patients with suspected endocarditis will be examined by echocardiography. Therefore, patients for the endocarditis Register can easily be identified. The Register will comprise structured data records of all patients including klinical data, laboratory data and multimodal Imaging (echocardiography, leukocyte scintigraphy, PET/CT, Imaging of inflamation with tracer-antibodies

Name: Collection HIB MH10 Strahlentherapie
Description:
The Project is part of the MHH-HIB collection.
Patient collective: Patients with early side effects during radiotherapy of a Tumor disease (at beginning of the irradiation series, low dose irradiation)
Inclusion criteria:
-Definitive radiotherapy of a Tumor disease 
- Age ≥ 18, consent ability
- complete medical anmanesis with medication
- early radiogenic side effects
Exclusion criteria:
- palliative radiotherapy (not curative)
- monogenic hereditary diseases
- planed radiation dose not achieved

Name: Collection Hautgewebebank Hannover
Description: Establishment of a skin tissue collection for severely burned patients.

Name: Collection of the apheresis of dialysis patients Hannover
Description: Plasma collection of the apheresis of dialysis patients.

Name: Collection KFO311 TP1 Hannover
Description: The TP1 examines in a common register prospectively all patients who are treated with a support system due to an acute or terminal failure of the heart or lung; This is the extra extracorporeal Membranoxigenierung (ECMO, Veno-Arterial, Venovenös), Transvasal introduced in the left or right ventricle Microaxialpumpen (e.g. Impella) and also the surgically implanted ventricular assist-devices (VAD).

Name: Collection Neocyst Hannover
Description:
Network for Early Onset Cystic Kidney Disease:
NEOCYST is a multicenter, interdisciplinary network of clinicians and scientists exploring early onset cystic kidney diseases. Hereditary cystic kidney diseases are among the most important causes of chronic renal failure in childhood.
The goals of NEOCYSTare to increase the knowledge on the epidemiology, the phenotypical spectrum, the underlying genetic and pathophysiological mechanisms as well as the individual prognosis of early onset cystic kidney diseases and thereby to improve the clinical management and counselling of affected patients.

NEOCYST ist ein multidisziplinäres, multizentrisches Netzwerk zur Erforschung zystischer Nierenerkrankungen des Kindesalters. Es handelt sich um einen Verbund aus Klinikern, Genetikern und Wissenschaftlern, die gemeinsam das Ziel verfolgen, die Betreuung, die Therapie sowie die Lebensqualität von Patienten mit zystischen Nierenerkrankungen zu verbessern.
Erbliche zystische Nierenerkrankungen repräsentieren eine der häufigsten Ursachen eines chronischen Nierenversagens im Kindesalter. Gleichzeitig zählen sie zur Gruppe der „Seltenen Erkrankungen“, so dass nur wenige hundert Patienten in Deutschland betroffen sind. Alle zystischen Nierenerkrankungen zeichnen sich durch ein hohes Maß an phänotypischer wie genetischer Variabilität aus. Zudem erschweren erhebliche Krankheitsüberschneidungen eine frühzeitige Diagnose sowie eine individuelle Beratung betroffener Patienten und deren Familien.

Name: Collection Porto-Pulmonary Hypertension-MHHHannover
Description: Porto-pulmonary hypertension is a pre-capillary pulmonary hypertension associated with hepatic disease or portal hypertension.

Name: LIFE_LONG-COVID-Studie
Description:
Um Patient:innen mit Post-COVID-Symptomen künftig besser therapieren oder Komplikationen im besten Fall vorbeugen zu können, erforscht die Universitätsmedizin Leipzig die Folgeerscheinungen nach einer SARS-CoV2-Infektion. Hierfür arbeitet die Erwachsenenambulanz des Leipziger Forschungszentrums für Zivilisationserkrankungen LIFE der Universität Leipzig eng mit der Post-COVID-Hochschulambulanz am Universitätsklinikum Leipzig und dem Netzwerk der Allgemeinärztlichen Lehrpraxen der Universitätsmedizin zusammen. Ziel des Vorhabens ist es, den dringenden Bedarf einer klinischen Charakterisierung des Post-COVID-Verlaufs zu decken, um geeignete diagnostische Prozesse für die Prävention und Therapie von Post-COVID-Komplikationen zu entwickeln.

Zu diesem Zweck werden 400 Patient:innen mit überstandener SARS-CoV2-Infektion systematisch nach klinischen und epidemiologischen Standards mehrfach untersucht bzw. befragt. Das Programm umfasst umfangreiche standardisierte Befragungen sowie körperliche und apparative Untersuchungen. Die Kohorte setzt sich dabei aus Proband:innen der LIFE-ADULT-Studie, von denen bereits Gesundheitsdaten aus der Zeit vor ihrer COVID-Erkrankung vorliegen, aus Patient:innen der Post-COVID-Hochschulambulanz sowie aus Patient:innen der Allgemeinärztlichen Lehrpraxen der Universitätsmedizin zusammen. Weiterhin ist die Befragung von nicht von einer SARS-CoV2-Erkrankung betroffenen Vergleichsprobanden aus der LIFE Adult-Studie geplant.  Dies ermöglicht die Charakterisierung von Patient:innen mit aus der Vergangenheit vorliegender Ausgangsuntersuchung sowie die Abbildung schwerer Krankheitsverläufe. Eine Vorgehensweise, die das Forschungsvorhaben von vergleichbaren Studien deutlich unterscheidet.

Name: Collection Probase Hannover
Description: A modern concept for general PSA screening is being investigated in the PROBASE study (risk-adjusted prostate cancer early detection study based on a "baseline" PSA value in young men - a prospective multicenter randomized trial). In this risk-adapted strategy, the PSA tests are performed as a function of the individual risk of the man, which is determined by means of a basic PSA value at the age of 45 or 50 years.

Name: Collection Q-Map Hannover
Description: In the Q-Map study (quality markers to access processing delay), the extent to which the delayed processing of blood and urine samples has an influence on later analyzes, in particular whether metabolites can be used as markers for such delayed processing ( Metabolites are metabolic products such as sugars, fats, amino acids, etc.) and whether a delayed isolation of blood cells from blood samples, eg by transport times, has an influence on the yield and viability of these cells. Overall, this study is designed to continuously improve and test the quality of biomaterials.

Name: Collection REBIRTH active woman Hannover
Description: "REBIRTH aktiv women" is a study of the Hannover Medical School, which involved female employees between 45 and 60 years, provided they had never before done sports. About 300 staff members, from the nursing staff to the laboratory assistant, reportedly practiced 30 minutes a day. The scientists had already suspected that sports are fit. The fact that the effects set such a clear signal, no one had expected: The physical life could be reduced by more than ten years within this short time.

Name: Collection TX-Kohorte Hannover
Description: The DZIF Transplant Cohort is unique in Germany and aims to help improve treatment of patients who have already received a donor organ or had a stem cell transplant.

Name: Collection Tourette MHHannover
Description:
Ziel der Studie ist es, die relativ seltene Erkrankung Tourette-Syndrom genauer untersuchen zu können und möglicherweise die Diagnostik oder Behandlung der Patienten zu verbessern. Für zukünftige Forschungsfragen ist eine derartige „Tourette-Biobank“ von großer Bedeutung. 
Patientenkollektiv: 
Einschlusskriterien sind Patienten mit chronischen primären Tic-Störungen (chronisch motorische Tic-Störung, chronische vokale Tic-Störung und Tourette-Syndroms) 
- jedes Alter 
- Männer und Frauen 
Ausschlusskriterien: 
- sekundäre Tic-Störungen 
- vorübergehende Tic-Störung

Name: Collection Chino Hannover
Description:
"The aim of this study is to investigate the change in leukocyte populations in patients treated with checkpoint inhibitors with malignant diseases. For this purpose, lymphocyte receptors and histamine receptors from blood samples are analyzed more precisely in order to get important insights into the therapy with checkpoint inhibitors.
"

Name: Collection GAIN Hannover
Description:
Das German multi-organ Auto-Immunity Network (GAIN) ist ein Zusammenschluss von Ärzten und Wissenschaftlern der Universitäten Freiburg, Hannover, München und Kiel mit dem Ziel der Erforschung von Multi-Organ-Autoimmunerkrankungen. Multi-Organ-Autoimmunerkrankungen gehören zu den sehr seltenen Erkrankungen und werden häufig durch monogenetische Mutation in bestimmten immunregulatorischen Genen ausgelöst. 

Das GAIN Projekt soll die Pathophysiologie untersuchen und neue genetische Ursachen identifizieren,. Auch soll ein Patientenregister und eine Biobank für Multi-Organ-Autoimmunerkrankungen aufgebaut werden. Die gesammelten Probe und Daten sollen zukünftig internen und externen wissenschaftlichen Projekten zur Verfügung stehen. Die Untersuchung der gesammelten Patientenproben soll Einblicke in die Funktion und das Zusammenspiel der betroffenen Gene mit dem Immunsystem ermöglichen. Diese sind von besonderem Interesse für die Wissenschaft, da sie sich auch auf häufiger auftretende Erkrankungen des Immunsystems übertragen lassen. Durch das Verständnis der zugrunde liegenden molekularen Pathogenitätsmechanismen soll die Voraussetzung geschaffen werden, das Gleichgewicht des Immunsystems wieder herzustellen und so langfristig die Patientenversorgung zu verbessern. Hierfür wegweisend ist bereits eine begleitende klinische Studie (ABACHAI) für Patienten mit CTLA4-Insuffiziens, die eine personalisierte, also auf ihre Mutation abgestimmt, Therapie erhalten.

Name: Collection Lung-Tx Hannover
Description:
For patients with the most severe end-stage pulmonary disease, such as COPD, the only curative therapy option is lung transplantation, which is reserved for a highly selective patient population.
Especially in the case of lung transplantation, an increasing mismatch of potential organ receivers to organ donors is observed, which leads to a progra- tient mortality of the patients on the waiting list.

Name: KORA: health research in the region of Augsburg
Description: KORA is a population based study on participants living in the region of Augsburg, Germany; KORA collects biosamples and data since 1985 and consists of a number of different surveys and follow-up surveys.
Sample Access Description: access to samples and data is granted on the basis of project agreements with collaboration of a KORA researcher
Data Access Description: access to samples and data is granted on the basis of project agreements with collaboration of a KORA researcher

Name: (1,3)-β-D-glucan Based Diagnosis of Invasive Candida Infection in Sepsis (CANDISEP)
Description: Candisep is a German randomized controlled multicenter trial to investigate the effect of an early antifungal therapy guided by (1,3)-β-D-glucan measurement versus standard of care on 28-day mortality in patients with severe sepsis or septic shock and an increased risk for an invasive candida infection. Heparin- and EDTA-plasma is taken after randomization and on the days 1 to 9 after randomization. Samples are processed locally according to standardised operating procedures and stored centrally at -80 °C.
Sample Access Description: Please, contact PI with a short proposal of the desired project. A study protocol and a positive vote of our ethics committee is necessary before access is possible. Contracting may be necessary for commercial partners. Publication of results in cooperation with the CSCC is mandatory.

Name: Systems Medicine of Community Acquired Pneumonia (CAPSyS)
Description:
CAPSyS is a sub-study of the PROGRESS study of the Pneumonia Research Network on Genetic Resistance and Susceptibility for the Evolution of Severe Sepsis. The CAPSyS add-on protocol expands the observational, longitudinal case-cohort study PROGRESS by adding sample collection from the upper and lower airways and assessments addressing barrier function in the lung. The CAPSyS protocol is activated in selected study centers and applied to ventilated patients on ICU. Activation of the CAPSyS protocol can commence up to seven days after hospitalization for CAP. Patient's progress is followed in much detail for up to six days after protocol activation. Further data are collected until discharge from the hospital. Patients are followed up on at days 28, 180, and 360. 
Baseline assessment comprises sociodemographic, anamnestic, family history, and live style information. Pneumonia risk stratification scores Pneumonia Severity Index (PSI) and CURB-65 are determined upon enrolment. At enrollment and for up to six subsequent study days routine laboratory data, clinical observations, and information on therapy are documented. The Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) score, Systemic Inflammatory Response Syndrome (SIRS) status, and organ dysfunction are documented for the same time frame. Starting with enrollment, up to six consecutive sets of biomaterials are collected comprising serum, plasma, and materials for extraction of RNA. Blood for extraction of DNA is collected once. Airway materials (nasal and throat swabs, tracheal secretion, bronchoalveolar lavage) are obtained at protocol activation and tracheal secretion again five days after. Follow up comprises vital status, housing situation, recurrence of pneumonia, and a quality of life questionnaire.
CAPSyS addresses the airway and lung compartment in patients enrolled into the PROGRESS study. The aim is to better understand the lung microbiome and barrier function in CAP patients in regard to patient heterogeneity regarding outcome in the hospital and the development of novel treatment concepts.

Name: Hydrocortisone for Prevention of Septic Shock (HYPRESS)
Description:
Severe sepsis is a disease with a high mortality. Development of shock is a most serious complication and increases the risk of death considerably. Application of low dose hydrocortisone is currently recommended only in patients after severe septic shock has been established. Hydrocortisone therapy has a hemodynamic stabilizing effect and may reverse shock, however, the preventive application has not been investigated in a larger study. The study investigates whether low dose hydrocortisone prevents the development of shock in patients with severe sepsis. It is postulated that shock prevention may also affect morbidity and mortality.
HYPRESS is a placebo-controlled, randomised, double-blind study to investigate the efficacy and safety of low dose hydrocortisone to prevent the development of septic shock in patients with severe sepsis.
Sample Access Description: The SepNet Study Guidance Committee will assess and decide on the use of the samples upon application.

Name: Prospektive diagnostische Studie: Innovative Diagnostik für Pneumonien bei Immunsuppression (IDES)
Description:
Sample collection of patients with immunosuppression with or without pneumonia
Sample collection of age-matched healthy controls

Name: Conversion of alpha linolenic acid (KoALA)
Description: The KoALA study focuses on the impact of variations in the background diet as a confounding factor. The intake of linoleic acid (LA, C18:2 n-6) has been suggested to diminish the metabolism of α-linolenic acid (ALA, C18:3 n-3) to eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA, C20:5 n-3) and docosahexaenoic acid (DHA, 22:6 n-3. In this context, NuCo Study III will be conducted to evaluate the influence of the background diet, in particular the impact of the simultaneous intake of LA on the conversion of ALA into their long-chain (LC) metabolites, the incorporation of n-3 LC-PUFA in human tissues and their metabolism into eicosanoids and docosanoids. Further, the influence of a regular intake of milk fat, in particular from free-grazing ruminants, on n-3 PUFA metabolism will be investigated, because short- and middle-chain fatty acids as well as the branched-chain fatty acids in milk fat may influence the conversion of ALA into n-3 LC-PUFA (hypothesis). Thus, validated nutrition concepts for increasing n-3 LC-PUFA status from plant sources will be developed.

Name: Comparison of Two Antibiotic Regimen (Meropenem Versus Meropenem+Moxifloxacin)in the Treatment of Severe Sepsis and Septic Shock (MAXSEP)
Description:
Severe sepsis and septic shock are diseases of infectious origin with a high risk of death. Antibiotic therapy is mandatory but it is unknown whether one antibiotic alone is sufficient for initial therapy. The purpose of this study is to compare a therapy with meropenem alone or the combination of meropenem plus moxifloxacin in the treatment of severe sepsis/ septic shock. Patients randomly receive one of the two treatments for at least 7 days but not longer than 14 days.
MAXSEP is a prospective, randomized, open, multicentre study about the effect of an empirical antibiotic monotherapy with meropenem (Meronem®) versus a combination therapy with moxifloxacin (Avalox®) on organ dysfunction in patients with severe sepsis and septic shock.
Sample Access Description: The SepNet Study Guidance Committee will assess and decide on the use of the samples upon application.

Name: Prospective Observational Study on Hospitalized Community Acquired Pneumonia (PROGRESS)
Description:
PROGRESS is a study of the Pneumonia Research Network on Genetic Resistance and Susceptibility for the Evolution of Severe Sepsis. In this observational, longitudinal case-cohort study, patients are enrolled within 48 hours of hospitalization and patient's progress is followed in much detail for up to six days. Further data are collected until discharge from the hospital. Patients are followed up on at days 28, 180, and 360. 
Baseline assessment comprises sociodemographic, anamnestic, family history, and live style information. Pneumonia risk stratification scores Pneumonia Severity Index (PSI) and CURB-65 are determined upon enrolment. At enrollment and for up to six subsequent study days routine laboratory data, clinical observations, and information on therapy are documented. The Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) score, Systemic Inflammatory Response Syndrome (SIRS) status, and organ dysfunction are documented for the same time frame. Starting with enrollment, up to six consecutive sets of biomaterials are collected comprising serum, plasma, and materials for extraction of RNA. Blood for extraction of DNA is collected once. Follow up comprises vital status, housing situation, recurrence of pneumonia, and a quality of life questionnaire.
It is a major aim of PROGRESS to understand and predict patient heterogeneity regarding outcome in the hospital and to develop novel treatment concepts. 
The PROGRESS study was retrospectively registered on May 24th, 2016 with ClinicalTrials.gov: NCT02782013.

Name: Placebo Controlled Trial of Sodium Selenite and Procalcitonin Guided Antimicrobial Therapy in Severe Sepsis (SISPCT)
Description:
Severe sepsis and septic shock are diseases of infectious origin with a high risk of death. The purpose of this study is to determine whether the intravenous application of selenium (given as sodium-selenite) can reduce mortality in patients with severe sepsis or septic shock. Additionally, it is investigated, whether the measurement of procalcitonin - a marker of infection - can be used to guide anti-infectious measures in this disease.
SISPCT is a prospective, randomized multicenter trial of adjunctive intravenous therapy with sodium-selenite(Selenase®, double-blinded) and a procalcitonin guided causal therapy (Open) of severe sepsis or septic shock.
Sample Access Description: The SepNet Study Guidance Committee will assess and decide on the use of the samples upon application.

Name: Therapeutic drug monitoring-based dose optimisation of piperacillin/tazobactam to improve outcome in patients with sepsis (TARGET)
Description: Sepsis is a life-threatening organ dysfunction caused by a dysregulated host response to infection with hospital mortality in excess of 40% despite modern supportive care. Along with insufficient and delayed empirical antimicrobial therapy, inappropriate antimicrobial exposure has been identified to negatively affect patient outcomes. Using therapeutic drug monitoring (TDM) guided antimicrobial therapy with dosing tailored to the altered pharmacokinetics of the individual patient in combination with continuous infusion may be an appropriate strategy to overcome the problems of under- and overdosing of beta-lactam antibiotics. This current trial will address the question whether a TDM-based treatment approach in patients with sepsis and continuous infusion of piperacillin/tazobactam will result in a greater resolution of organ dysfunction and hence better clinical outcome compared to dosing according to manufacturers’ recommendations.

Name: Collection TARGETFN Jena
Description: Samples from adult patients with febrile neutropenia treated with Piperacillin-Tazobactam

Name: Efficacy of Volume Substitution and Insulin Therapy in Severe Sepsis (VISEP)
Description:
The purpose of this trial is to determine the influence of colloid versus crystalloid volume resuscitation and of intensive vs conventional insulin therapy on morbidity and mortality of patients with severe sepsis and septic shock.
VISEP is a prospective randomized multicenter study on the influence of colloid vs crystalloid volume resuscitation and of intensive vs conventional insulin therapy on outcome in patients with severe sepsis and septic shock.
Sample Access Description: The SepNet Study Guidance Committee will assess and decide on the use of the samples upon application.

Name: Main Collection ICB-Lübeck
Description: ICB-L main collection, comprising all samples

Name: LD-HRCT - Early detection of lung cancer and mesotheliomas
Description: The collective is made up of employees who were exposed to asbestos dust for at least 10 years prior to 1985 and who are or were smokers (at least 30 pack years) or who have a recognized occupational disease BK 4103.
Biobank Label: Biobank des Instituts für Prävention und Arbeitsmedizin der Deutschen Gesetzlichen Unfallversicherung Institut der Ruhr-Universität Bochum (IPA)

Name: MoMar - Early detection of lung cancer and mesotheliomas
Description: A large prospective cohort of subjects exposed to asbestos was recruited in 2008 - 2018 to validate a panel of markers as part of preventive examinations in northern Germany, North Rhine-Westphalia and in the Rhine-Neckar region in high-risk collectives. The markers cover three molecular levels: proteins / peptides, DNA methylation and microRNAs.
Biobank Label: Biobank des Instituts für Prävention und Arbeitsmedizin der Deutschen Gesetzlichen Unfallversicherung Institut der Ruhr-Universität Bochum (IPA)

Name: PURE - Early detection of bladder cancer
Description:
Incident cases with a histologically confirmed tumor of the bladder; (Exclusion criteria: cancer outside the urogenital tract)
Control group: Incident cases with another histologically confirmed tumor or inflammatory diseases of the genitourinary tract
Control group (healthy): population-based healthy controls via the Residents' Registration Office (exclusion criterion: all types of cancer)
Biobank Label: Biobank des Instituts für Prävention und Arbeitsmedizin der Deutschen Gesetzlichen Unfallversicherung Institut der Ruhr-Universität Bochum (IPA)

Name: PURE - Early detection of lung tumors and mesotheliomas
Biobank Label: Biobank des Instituts für Prävention und Arbeitsmedizin der Deutschen Gesetzlichen Unfallversicherung Institut der Ruhr-Universität Bochum (IPA)

Description: The verification of the marker candidates from PURE Lunge 1 using a general clinical collective.
Biobank Label: Biobank des Instituts für Prävention und Arbeitsmedizin der Deutschen Gesetzlichen Unfallversicherung Institut der Ruhr-Universität Bochum (IPA)

Name: Shift work - nurses
Description: Health effects of shift work. Investigation of the influence of shift work on the metabolome and hormone profiles in nurses.
Biobank Label: Biobank des Instituts für Prävention und Arbeitsmedizin der Deutschen Gesetzlichen Unfallversicherung Institut der Ruhr-Universität Bochum (IPA)

Name: PURE – Early detection of recurrence of bladder cancer
Description: Marker-assisted aftercare of patients with non-muscle-invasive low / intermediate-risk bladder tumors. Sample collection time: 2016 -2020, in hospitals in Erlangen, Tübingen, Herne, Rostock, Nürnberg
Biobank Label: Biobank des Instituts für Prävention und Arbeitsmedizin der Deutschen Gesetzlichen Unfallversicherung Institut der Ruhr-Universität Bochum (IPA)

Name: UroScreen - Early detection of bladder cancer in chemical workers
Description: Molecular epidemiological studies of bladder cancer in chemical workers 2003-2011. A highly stressed collective (ODIN) has been cared for in-depth occupational medicine for 10 years. All cases of bladder cancer that occurred in this group were recorded. The tumor material was submitted to the IPA for molecular biological analysis.
Biobank Label: Biobank des Instituts für Prävention und Arbeitsmedizin der Deutschen Gesetzlichen Unfallversicherung Institut der Ruhr-Universität Bochum (IPA)

Name: Study of Health in Pomerania
Description: The Study of Health in Pomerania (SHIP) is an epidemiological, population-based study in Western Pomerania. Prevalence and incidence of common risk factors, subclinical disorders and clinical diseases have been assessed since 1997 in five-year intervals. The third follow up (SHIP-3) was assessed between 2014 and 2016. In addition, an independent representative population sample was investigated between 2008 - 2012 (SHIP-TREND). Recently, the first follow up of this cohort has been started (SHIP-TREND-1).

Name: Plasma-PBMCcoll
Description:
Blood cell isolates (e.g. buffy coat) from 200 donors (approx. 50 samples are collected annually), plasma samples from 3000 donors (approx. 800 samples are collected annually).

Clinical data exist of the donors and there are study-specific declarations of consent.
Biobank Label: Plasma- and PBMC-Collection of Infectiology of the LMU

Name: Biomaterials of transplanted patiens of the DZIF Transplant Cohort
Description:
Biomaterials from patients, who received a transplantation of heart, liver, kidney, pancras or stemcells:

- EDTA Buffy Coat
- EDTA Plasma
- EDTA Serum
- Isolated PBMCs
- Stabilized RNA 
- Stool
- Urine
Biobank Label: Transplant Cohort of the German Center for Infectious Research e.V.

Name: UCCH-Biobank
Description: The biospecimen resource of the University Cancer Center Hamburg (UCCH) - the UCCH Biobank - stores cancer-derived and cancer-relevant biospecimens that range from fresh frozen and formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded tissue of solid tumors to blood cells, serum, urine and more processed biomaterials like DNA, RNA and protein extracts.

Name: Ability to collect COVID-19 cases
Description: Ability to prospectively collect COVID-19 cases for new research collaborations.
Biobank Label: Central Biobank University Medical Center Göttingen

Name: Ability to collect COVID-19 cases
Description: Ability to prospectively collect COVID-19 cases for new research collaborations.

Name: CVD
Description: Kardiovaskuläre Erkrankungen sind weiterhin Todesursache Nr 1. in Deutschland. Ziel des Vorhabens ist der Aufbau einer Gefäß-Biomaterialbank im Rahmen der Sektion „chronische inflammatorische Erkrankungen" der zentralen Biobank der Medizinischen Fakultät unter Führung des Gefäßzentrums. Das im Rahmen verschiedener Gefäßerkrankungen gesammelte Material soll zu einem späteren Zeitpunkt für die Klärung wissenschaftlicher Fragestellungen im Bereich der Gefäßmedizin verwendet werden. Zu den Hauptfragestellungen zählen die Erforschung des Restenose-Prozesse nach Gefäßeingriffen sowie die Klärung der Pathomechanismen bei der Entstehung von Aneurysmata in verschiedenen Lokalisationen.

Name: LIFE-Adult-Study Basis Leipzig
Description:
Ziel der LIFE-Adult-Studie ist es, aussagekräftige Gesundheitsdaten einer breiten Bevölkerungsschicht zu gewinnen, wobei der Gesundheitsstatus und (frühe) pathologische Veränderungen der Probanden erfasst werden. Dies ist Voraussetzung, um die Heterogenität von Erkrankungen aufzuklären und neue frühdiagnostische und präventive Ansatzpunkte zu finden.

Im Mittelpunkt stehen dabei Zivilisationserkrankungen wie Herz-Kreislauf-Erkrankungen, metabolische Erkrankungen, Depressionen, Kognition und Hirnfunktion, Schlafstörungen und Vigilanzregulation, degenerative Netzhauterkrankungen und Allergien.

Die LIFE-Erwachsenenstudie ist als prospektive, longitudinale, bevölkerungsbezogene Kohortenstudie angelegt. Nach umfangreichen Vorbereitungen und einer Phase der Pilotierung mit 400 Probanden, erfolgte im Zeitraum August 2011 bis November 2014 die querschnittliche Basiserhebung an 10.000 zufällig ausgewählten erwachsenen Leipziger Bürgern im Alter zwischen 20 und 79 Jahren.

Jeder Teilnehmer wurde um eine Blut- und eine Urinprobe gebeten. Ein umfangreiches Labor-Sofortprogramm wurde realisiert, so dass für nahezu jeden Studienteilnehmer etwa 70 Laborparameter vorliegen. Dazu kommen von mehr als 9.900 Probanden bei -80 °C bzw. bei -150 °C asservierte Bioproben (Plasma, Serum, Lymphozyten für DNA, RNA und Urin).

Jeder Teilnehmer absolvierte ein etwa 5- bis 6-stündiges Untersuchungsprogramm. Mehr als 3000 Probanden aus ausgewählten Altersgruppen nahmen darüber hinaus an einem 4-stündigen EEG- und mehr als 2500 Personen an einem MRT-Programm gleicher Länge teil.

Das Untersuchungsprogramm bestand aus körperlichen und apparativen Untersuchungen, Befragungen, Selbstausfüllerfragebögen und psychometrischen Tests.

Name: LIFE-CHILD-Study Leipzig
Description: LIFE Child ist eine prospektiv bevölkerungsbezogene Kohortenstudie im Großraum Leipzig zur Erforschung molekularer Ursachen von umwelt- und lebensstilassoziierten Erkrankungen im Kindes- und Jugendalter. Dazu untersuchen und befragen wir bereits Schwangere ab der 24. Schwangerschaftswoche und deren Säuglinge im 3., 6. und 12. Lebensmonat. Kinder ab einem Jahr laden wir jährlich mit ihren Eltern ein, unseren Studientag zu durchlaufen. Durch die Breite der Rekrutierung hat diese Studie sowohl ein Längs- als auch ein Querschnittdesign. Somit bietet sich eine Vielzahl an Möglichkeiten der Auswertung. Das Ziel der Studie ist es, aus den gewonnenen Informationen die multifaktoriellen Ursachen von Zivilisationskrankheiten zu bestimmen, deren Risikofaktoren zu identifizieren, und die jeweiligen Mechanismen zu verstehen, um zukünftig der Entstehung bzw. Ausprägung dieser Krankheiten wirksam vorbeugen zu können.

Name: LIFE-HEART-Study Leipzig
Description: ​​​Die LIFE Heart-Studie rekrutierte von 2006 bis 2014 insgesamt 7.000 Patient:innen mit Verdacht auf koronare Herzerkrankung, manifester Herzerkrankung oder Myokardinfarkt. Alle Patient:innen erhielten eine Koronarangiographie, sodass der Gefäßstatus im Herzen exakt bekannt ist. Diese Untersuchung ist in populationsbezogenen Studien nicht durchführbar. Zudem wurden die Patient:innen tiefgehend hinsichtlich des generellen Gefäßstatus und der Gesundheit des Herzkreislaufsystems untersucht. Umfangreiche Umweltfaktoren wurden erfasst. Die Kohorte ist tiefgehend molekular und labormedizinisch charakterisiert. Viele Untersuchungen sind identisch mit denen in LIFE Adult, sodass weitreichende Vergleichsmöglichkeiten zwischen den Kohorten bestehen. Die LIFE Heart-Studie ist die größte koronarangiographisch charakterisierte Kohorte in Deutschland und eine der größten weltweit.

Name: Tumorbiobank
Description: Seit 2017 werden Blut- und Gewebeproben von Patient:innen mit Tumorerkrankungen in Kooperation mit dem universitären Krebszentrum Leipzig (UCCL), dem Institut für Pathologie, diverser Kliniken des Universitätsklinikums Leipzig sowie dem Institut für Laboratoriumsmedizin gesammelt. Im Fokus stehen dort derzeit maligne Erkrankungen des Gastrointestinaltraktes, des Brust- und Bauchraumes, der Brust und des Uterus sowie Sarkome und maligne hämatologische Erkrankungen.

Name: LTX
Description: DNA, cDNA/RNA, isolated blood cells, fluids and tissue

Name: Immunmonitoring
Description: The aim of the sample collection is to use the samples as positive controls for immune monitoring in order to verify the quality of the stains / stimulations.
Biobank Label: Biobank des Instituts für medizinische Mikrobiologie, Immunologie und Hygiene der Technischen Universität München

Name: HIV-HCV collection
Description: About one third of all HIV patients in Europe are coinfected with hepatitis C (HCV). The presence of HIV-associated immunodeficiency accelerates the course of HCV-mediated liver disease, leading to fibrosis, cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma. Therefore, mortality rates associated with liver disease in this patient population have increased in recent years. The biobank of the Medical Clinic I of the University Hospital Bonn aims to identify genetic and immunological markers that play a role in the immunopathogenesis of both HIV and HCV. A special focus is on liver diseases and the relation to clinical data.
Biobank Label: Biobank der Inneren Medizin, Medizinische Klinik I, Universitätsklinikum Bonn

Name: Popgen Biobank
Description: Popgen is a comprehensive biobank and database for population-based and disease-specific questions as well as a central infrastructure for conducting epidemiological studies. Popgen is used to investigate molecular and non-molecular risk factors for numerous civilization diseases (e.g. diseases of the cardiovascular system, inflammatory diseases, neurological diseases or cancer). Through a better understanding of the molecular and non-molecular basis of these diseases, the biobank is intended to contribute to improved prevention, diagnosis and treatment options in the future.

Name: Lymphatic Filariasis
Description: The aim of the studies in the Specht research group at the Institute of Medical Microbiology, Immunology and Parasitology is to test the therapeutic efficiency of antibiotics against lymphatic filariasis and onchocerciasis.
Biobank Label: Biobank des Instituts für Medizinischen Mikrobiologie, Immunologie und Parasitologie des Universitätsklinikum Bonn

Name: Neuro-Biobank Tübingen
Description: collection of blood samples, Serum, Plasma, CSF, PBMC´s, DNA, Fibroblasts, Urine, Stool and RNA from patients with neurological diseases

Name: Main collection of the National Register for Congenital Heart Defects
Description: Blood, Saliva and Cardiac Tissue (incl. derived material: DNA, RNA etc) from Patients with Congenital Heart Defects and Family Members
Sample Access Description:
Regulations regarding the Use of Data and Samples: 
For initiating a study, the submission of an Application is mandatory. An Inquiry to the Management Office (regarding, for instance, the availability of samples) can be made in advance. Applications are possible for register data, samples from the biorepository or the Register infrastructure (IT platform, databases, logistics) with the aim of prospective data or sample collections. Applications and Inquiries will be treated as confidential.
Decisions regarding the provision of data, samples or the infrastructure for a study are made by the KNAHF Steering Committee and the NRAHF Executive Board. In the case that data and samples are released, both boards jointly act as Data Access Committee. The boards decide on the basis of recommendations of the Review Board. Furthermore, the use of samples that were collected by certain institutions requires the approval of the institution in question.
Data Access Description: see sample access rules
Image Access Description: see sample access rules
Biobank Label: National Register for Congenital Heart Defects

Name: BMB-CCC-Onco
Description: Main focus of the oncological collection lies in the field of tumor diseases of the digestive organs and the lung. the collection comprises residual tissue samples (unfixed cryo-) from cancer patients' surgical resectates (tumor and peritumoral non-malignant tissue specimen) as well as extensive collections of  liquid samples (blood, bone marrow) and sub-entities thereof (e.g. plasma, serum, PBMC-RNA).
Sample Access Description: Access can be provided via the P2N-Biobank Network and its governance and rules of order. Applications may be submitted via the P2N-online portal.
Data Access Description: see under sample access

Name: Main collection of The Northern Sweden MONICA study, comprising of all the samples.
Stiftung PATH Biobank
Description: PATH Biobank is a breast cancer biobank in Germany focused on fresh frozen tumor tissue, blood serum samples and corresponding FFPE-tissue
Biobank Label: Stiftung PATH - Patients' Tumor Bank of Hope

Name: PEPSI
Description: We collect blood/plasma samples from HCV-infected patients for HCV resistance testing. We also collect treatment and viral load data from the patients. These data are then used for molecular epidemiology as well as development of HCV therapy-optimisation tools (geno2pheno[HCV]).

Name: Existing collection of COVID-19 cases
Description: Existing collection of COVID-19 cases

Description: Ability to prospectively collect COVID-19 cases for new research collaborations.

Name: Main collection of National Human Biological Environmental Biobank, comprising of all the samples.
Collection of RWTH cBMB Broad Consent Aachen
Description: Die Schwerpunkte der RWTH cBMB-Forschungsprojekte sind im Bereich onkologischer, kardiologischer und neurologischer Erkrankungen und entsprechen damit der strategischen Ausrichtung der Forschung der Medizinischen Fakultät der RWTH Aachen.
Biobank Label: Zentralisierte Biomaterialbank der RWTH Aachen University

Name: TxChirTUM
Description: More than 100 organ transplants (liver, kidney and combined pancreas / kidney transplantation) are performed every year at the Surgical Clinic and Polyclinic of the Klinikum rechts der Isar at the Technical University of Munich. The Biobank collects standardized tissue from recipients and donors as part of kidney, pancreas and liver transplants.
Biobank Label: Biobank of Transplantation surgery of Technical University Munich

Name: UGMLC Giessen Biobank main collection
Description:
Next to a large collection of liquid biospecimen (BAL-fluid, EDTA-blood, plasma and serum) from >1000 patients in the field of DPLD (mainly lung fibrosis, sarcoidosis, hypersensitivity pneumonitis), PH, ARDS/ALI and pneumonia, the biobank provides a large collection of tissue from explanted lungs and isolated cells. 
Within the last 10 years >900 explanted lungs (fibrosis ~330, PH ~120, COPD ~150, Donors ~170, other entities ~130) have been worked up according to standardized protocols. 
We collect fresh frozen and FFPE lung tissue, pieces of arteries, veins and bronchi, isolate cells (interstitial fibroblasts, pulmonary artery smooth muscle cells, adventitial fibroblasts) and generate precision cut lung slices (PCLS). The Biobank-team develops further protocols for isolation of other cell types (vascular endothelial and lung epithelial cells). 
In addition, a collection of biopsied tissue from lung cancer patients has recently been established (tumor, and tumor-free tissue from >110 lungs)

The UGLMC-Gießen Biobank also hosts the biobank of the European IPF registry/European ILD registry (eurIPFreg/eurILDreg) that was funded in frame of the European IPF network (FP7) in 2008 and enrolled >1000 patients with IIPs (idiopathic interstitial pneumonia) so far. The eurIPFreg biomaterial collection comprises the following specimens: BAL, serum, plamsa, EDTA-blood, PAXgene-blood, exhaled breath condensates, electric nose samples, and tissue from transbronchial biopsies or explanted lungs.

Name: Safety and Efficacy of Induced Pluripotent Stem Cell-derived Engineered Human Myocardium as Biological Ventricular Assist Tissue in Terminal Heart Failure
Description: The BioVAT-HF trial will test the hypothesis that cardiomyocyte implantation via engineered heart muscle (EHM), the proposed investigational medicinal product (IMP; designated "Biological Ventricular Assist Tissue" or BioVAT), results in sustainable remuscularization and biological enhancement of myocardial performance in the failing heart. EHM are constructed from defined mixtures of induced pluripotent stem cell (iPSC)-derived cardiomyocytes and stromal cells in a bovine collagen type I hydrogel. Comprehensive preclinical testing confirmed the rationale for the clinical translation of the myocardial remuscularization strategy by EHM implantation. The patient target population for EHM therapy is patients suffering from advanced heart failure with reduced ejection fraction (HFrEF; EF: ≤35%) and no realistic option for heart transplantation (NCT04396899).
Sample Access Description: Study-specific access process.
Data Access Description: Study-specific access process.
Biobank Label: Central Biobank University Medical Center Göttingen

Description: Existing collection of CoViD-19 cases.

Data Access Description: Access is managed by an use and access committee (UAC).

Sample Access Description: Study-specific access process.
Data Access Description: Study-specific access process.
Biobank Label: Central Biobank University Medical Center Göttingen

Name: NetBi-omics
Description: NetBi-omics ist neben PING und PD-CAN eine der drei von allen 9 Verbünden im "Forschungsnetz Psychische Erkrankungen" (https://fzpe.de/) vom Bundesministerium für Bildung und Forschung konsentierten Querschnittsplattformen.
Data Access Description: Study-specific access process.
Biobank Label: Central Biobank University Medical Center Göttingen

Name: Pharma_Krankheitsmodelle
Description: Herzmuskelgewebe kann sich nach einem Schaden nicht wieder aufbauen. Sowohl im Erwachsenen- als auch im Kindesalter ist Herzmuskelschwäche eine weitverbreitete Erkrankung, die sich nur schwer behandeln lässt. Im Institut für Pharmakologie und Toxikologie konstruieren wir für die individuelle Herzreparatur bei Herzmuskelschwäche Ersatzherzmuskeln aus Stammzellen und testen sie auf therapeutische Eignung. Unsere Mitarbeiter widmen sich in ihren Untersuchungen auch den Prozessen, die natürlicherweise die Herzentwicklung steuern. Auf diesem Wege gelingt es uns, die Mechanismen von Herzerkrankungen und von therapeutischen Ansätzen der biologischen Herzreparatur besser zu verstehen. Um unerwünschte Arzneimitteleigenschaften bereits vor der ersten klinischen Anwendung besser vorhersagen zu können und damit insgesamt die Arzneimittelsicherheit deutlich zu verbessern, werden in unserem Institut künstliche Gewebesysteme wie zum Beispiel Herzmuskeln, Skelettmuskeln, neuronale Netzwerke und Lebergewebe entwickelt und eingesetzt.
Sample Access Description: Study-specific access process.
Data Access Description: Study-specific access process.
Biobank Label: Central Biobank University Medical Center Göttingen

Name: Inhibition of Rho Kinase (ROCK) With Fasudil as Disease-modifying Treatment for Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS)
Description: Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) is a progressive neurodegenerative disorder and therapeutic options are limited. The rho kinase (ROCK) inhibitor Fasudil was shown to be neuroprotective, induced axonal regeneration and improved survival and behavioral outcome in models of ALS and other neurodegenerative diseases. The aim of this phase IIa, multi-center and double-blind study is to analyze the safety, tolerability and efficacy of fasudil in two different doses compared to placebo in approximately 16 trial sites in Germany, France and Switzerland. Intravenous application of fasudil will be performed in 80 patients and placebo in 40 patients two times daily for 20 treatment days. The hypothesis is that fasudil is safe and well-tolerated and its application will significantly improve the clinical outcome in patients with ALS (NCT03792490).
Sample Access Description: Study-specific access process.
Data Access Description: Study-specific access process.
Biobank Label: Central Biobank University Medical Center Göttingen

Name: Dortmunder Gesundheitsstudie
Description: Die bevölkerungsbasierte Dortmunder Gesundheitsstudie (DOGS) hat das Ziel, die Prävalenz und Inzidenz verschiedener Kopfschmerzarten und anderer chronischer Erkrankungen zu erheben und ihre Auswirkungen auf den Lebensalltag der Betroffenen zu untersuchen. In den Jahren 2003/04 wurden insgesamt 2291 Personen in die Studie eingeschlossen, davon nahmen 1312 an einer persönlichen Untersuchung, die übrigen an einer schriftlichen Befragung teil. Im Jahr 2006 wurden 77,8% der Überlebenden für eine Nachbefragung per Fragebogen erreicht. Bei der Datenanalyse und Interpretation der Auswirkungen der Erkrankungen auf den Lebensalltag hat der Einfluss sozialer Faktoren einen besonderen Stellenwert.
Biobank Label: Central Biobank of the Medical Faculty of Westfälische Wilhelms-Universität/WWU Münster

Name: Effect of Anti-Fibrotic Therapy on Regression of Myocardial Fibrosis after Transcatheter Aortic Valve Implantation (TAVI) in Aortic Stenosis Patients with High Fibrotic Burden
Description: The narrowing of the aortic valve (aortic valve stenosis) sometimes leads to a very pronounced pathological increase in the connective tissue of the heart muscle, a kind of scarring. This scarring is medically referred to as fibrosis. Severe cardiac fibrosis has a negative impact on heart recovery and long-term survival after surgery to replace a heart valve. The aim of this study is to investigate the effects of anti-fibrotic drugs (spironolactone and/or dihydralazine) on the increase in connective tissue in the heart muscle and the long-term survival of the patient after surgery to replace a heart valve (DRKS00019893).
Sample Access Description: Study-specific access process.
Data Access Description: Study-specific access process.
Biobank Label: Central Biobank University Medical Center Göttingen

Name: Molekular- und zellbiologische Analysen zur Erforschung und Verbesserung der Therapie des Rektumkarzinoms (KFO 179)
Description: The aim of the investigations is to use blood and tumour samples to gain a better understanding of the basics of carcinogenesis and to predict the response of tumours to established therapeutic concepts. This should enable an optimized treatment concept tailored to the patient ("therapy stratification"). In addition, the samples will be used to expand therapeutic options by developing new substances.
Sample Access Description: Study-specific access process.
Data Access Description: Study-specific access process.
Biobank Label: Central Biobank University Medical Center Göttingen

Name: Efficacy of Team-Based Care for Distressed Patients in Secondary Prevention of Chronic Coronary Heart Disease
Description: To confirm the efficacy of a team-based, multidisciplinary intervention addressing both medical and psychosocial risk factors delivered via a blended collaborative care strategy (TeamCare; TC). This strategy adds a trained care manager (CM) who is supervised by an interdisciplinary specialist team consisting of specialists in mental health and internal medicine/cardiology to usual care. The CM interacts closely with the patients and their treating physicians who stay in charge of all medical decisions. We intend to close the gap in comprehensive long-term follow-up care for patients suffering from both chronic coronary heart disease (CHD) and psychosocial distress by improving their health behaviors and health-related quality of life (HRQoL), which in turn can reduce risk factor burden, morbidity and mortality. Our primary hypothesis is that TC for both CHD and psychosocial distress will improve patients’ HRQoL significantly more than usual care for these conditions through improved risk factor control and reduced psychosocial distress. Secondary hypotheses are that TC will improve health behaviors, treatment adherence, cardiac risk factors, psychosocial functioning, mood and anxiety symptoms, and health care utilization in a sustainable way and beyond the end of the intervention (DRKS00020824).
Sample Access Description: Study-specific access process.

Name: Translational Registry for Cardiomyopathies-Plus (Second Phase)
Description: The DZHK TranslatiOnal Registry for CardiomyopatHies (DZHK TORCH) represents a unique resource of clinical data and high quality biological samples to enable innovative clinical and molecular studies on cardiomyopathies (CMP). This register is now to be expanded with a second phase (DZHK TORCH-Plus). The second phase DZHK TORCH-Plus consists of 4 main modules: 1. "Clinical phenotyping, follow-up & biosampling" 2. "Genomics", 3. "Inflammation" and 4. "Biomarker". The central aims are 1) to significantly increase the number of probands (n = 4340) in order to better address the different types of CMPs, especially patients with rare CMP forms such as LVNC and ARVC or with probably molecularly explainable cardiomyopathies (familial DCM), 2) to prolong the longitudinal with a further follow-up to achieve sufficient events and thereby derive clinical recommendations for risk assessment, 3) to increase the number of probands with state-of-the-art phenotyping, 4) to pinpoint the effect of myocardial inflammation, fibrosis, gender and to determine or predict genotypes based for outcome, 5) to validate novel biomarkers developed in other DZHK studies, and 6) to foster active cooperation with international CMP registries and partners from industry (NCT04265040).

If the application is approved, the EGCUT will sign a contract withthe applicant. The applicant will reimburse the costs of material release,regardless of whether the data are issued for scientific or commercial purposes. During the transfer of the health data and/or biological material, adata release form will be signed. The applicant will be asked to submit the results of the research project that were obtained using the data of thegene donors, to the EGCUT by the time specified in the contract. These results will complement the EGCUT database.

Name: The MONICA study  -  a longitudinel population database
Description:
MONICA is the acronym for “monitoring trends and determinants in cardiovascular disease,” and is a WHO-coordinated international CVD surveillance research program that began in the early 1980s (Tunstall-Pedoe et al. 1999). Like the Minnesota Heart Survey (MHS), which got underway in 1979, MONICA was designed to answer questions that arose at the Conference on the Decline of Coronary Heart Disease Mortality convened in 1978 at the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute in Bethesda: Was the apparent decline in CVD death rates, witnessed since the 1960s, genuine? If so, was improved survival or declining coronary event rates the primary contributor to the decline? What were the relative roles in the mortality trends of medical care and public health innovations?

MONICA assessed trends in community rates of hospitalized CVD events and their case fatality, along with trends in acute cardiovascular care, and carried out parallel population-based surveys of risk factors in 21 countries across four continents (ibid.) Inclusion criteria required advanced medical services for coronary heart disease, including stroke diagnostic imaging, thus restricting the study to developed countries (Tuomilehto, Pisa, Tunstall-Pedoe, 2003). No populations were surveyed from South America or Africa, and few from Asia

Name: GeneRISK Study
Description: The GeneRISK Study is a prospective observational study with focus on determining genetic risk factors of cardiovascular diseases and utilization of genetic and traditional risk factor information in disease prevention. Baseline samples were collected in 2015-2018, and the follow-up is still ongoing. High-quality DNA, plasma and serum samples are available from THL Biobank to 7315 sample donors aged 45-64 years. From the baseline THL Biobank can also provide extensive health and lifestyle data collected through health examinations, interviews and questionnaires and genome-wide SNP data (GWAS). The main goal of the GeneRISK Study is to communicate risk personal risk information directly to the study participants and monitor the effect in possible disease outcomes.

Name: Auria Biobank EDTA blood samples and data collection
Description: The EDTA collection is the largest blood sample based cohort of Auria Biobank. The objective is to take a 10 ml EDTA blood sample from every patient who has given their consent to Auria Biobank. Whole blood, plasma, buffy coat or DNA are available from these samples. Along with the current collection procedure, the sample is centrifuged, after which the plasma is divided into two units of 475 µl and the whole blood into two units of 400 µl. The samples are stored at a temperature of -80°C. Some of the whole blood samples that are collected due to the given biobank consent, are selected for DNA extraction. Hence the DNA is extracted from fresh blood and DNA concentration and purity of the samples are measured. DNA can also be extracted from deep-frozen blood samples. The samples are stored at a temperature of -80°C.
Sample Access Description: Auria Bank holds the authority on the use and assignment of the samples and related information it stores for biobank research. The biobank's scientific management group assesses in advance the planned research, as well as whether the statutory requirements governing the assignment of the sample have been met. The assignment of a sample requires a positive statement from the biobank's scientific steering group. The assignment of samples and their related information is always based on a written agreement with the receiver of the sample.
Data Access Description: Auria Bank holds the authority on the use and assignment of the samples and related information it stores for biobank research. Name: Health 2000 and 2011 Surveys
Description: A comprehensive 10-year follow-up survey of the Finnish population containing total of 8600 sample donors recruited in 2000 and 2011. The research material available in biobank consists of extensive health data, large-scale omics data (GWAS, WES, WGS, telomeres, NMR metabolomics), and high-quality DNA, serum, and plasma samples. Almost 8000 donors participated in the population survey in 2000 (of those, 1000 individuals also participated in Mini-Finland survey 20 years earlier during 1978-1980). In 2011, an extensive 10-year follow-up data and samples were collected from 4200 previous participants and approximately 800 new donors. The available longitudinal data consists of health examination, cognitive test results, interview and questionnaire data, physical and laboratory measurements, and NMR metabolomics data. Longitudinal samples of serum, plasma and DNA were collected by a well-defined protocol and are available in THL Biobank for research projects.
Sample Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for sample access descriptions

Name: Auria Biobank FFPE sample and data collection
Description: Auria Biobank's sample storage contains over a million FFPE (formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded) tissue samples that have been collected at Turku University Hospital since 1930. The samples are stored in a dry environment at room temperature in compliance with the diagnostics requirements of Turku University Hospital's Pathology Unit.
