Name: ATBC, Lung Cancer Prevention Study
Description: The ATBC study conducted between1984-1993 in Finland had nearly 29 000 middle-aged male participants. Available research material contains GWAS data currently from > 9000 participants and extensive amount of self-reported data, dietary information, physical and laboratory measurements. Samples include DNA (~17 000), and limited amount of serum. The Alpha-Tocopherol, Beta-Carotene (ATBC) Lung Cancer Prevention Study was a randomized, double-blinded, placebo-controlled trial testing whether alpha-tocopherol and/or beta-carotene supplements can reduce the incidence of lung cancer and other cancers. The participants received daily active supplements or placebo capsules for 5 to 8 years (median 6.1 years). All participants were smokers. The study was conducted in collaboration with the Finnish Institute for Health and Welfare (THL) and the U.S. National Cancer Institute (NCI) and itis still one of the largest lung cancer chemoprevention trials worldwide.
Sample Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for sample access descriptions
Data Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for data access descriptions

Name: Botnia Study
Description: The Botnia Study aims at characterizing the genetic and environmental factors predisposing to diabetes and its complications. It is one of the largest diabetes family studies in the world, initiated in 1990 on the western coast of Finland in the Gulf of Bothnia. A total of 15,200 participants are part of the Botnia study hosted by THL Biobank. For these individuals, DNA (and for a subset serum and plasma) samples, as well as physical and laboratory measurements, lifestyle and disease history information related to diabetes have been collected.  Two main substudies fit under the umbrella of the Botnia Study: (1) The Botnia Family Study, which includes individuals diagnosed with diabetes and unaffected family members; and (2) The Prevalence, Prediction and Prevention of Diabetes (PPP) Study, which recruited random individuals aged 18 to 75 years old from Western Finland. Genome-wide SNP data (array genotypes and imputed GWAS) are available for a total of 14,400 individuals.
Sample Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for sample access descriptions
Data Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for data access descriptions

Name: Corogene Study
Description: Corogene study includes over 5000 patients with coronary artery disease (CAD) and other related heart diseases, such as heart failure and aortic valve disease. All patients (aged 65.6 ±11.1 years) had been assigned for coronary angiogram at the Helsinki University Central hospital during 2006 to March 2008, when they also participated in the study. DNA and GWAS data are available from THL Biobank for almost all participants. The data include physiological measurements, basic lipid and CRP values as well as information on smoking. The objective of the study was to understand risk factors affecting the development and degree of heart diseases. Research was conducted by Helsinki University Hospital (HUS) in collaboration with University of Helsinki and National Institute for Health and Welfare (THL).
Sample Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for sample access descriptions
Data Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for data access descriptions

Name: The National FINRISK Study
Description: The National FINRISK Study has been conducted every 5 years during 1972-2012, to assess the risk factors of chronic diseases (e.g. CVD, diabetes, obesity, cancer) and health behavior in the working age population.  THL Biobank hosts samples and data from approx. 35000 participants, from survey years 1992-2012.  Data and samples were collected for this cross-sectional population survey at a baseline visit. The data includes background information on socioeconomic status, medical history, smoking, diet, physical activity, as well as information from the health examination, such as blood pressure, height and weight. A large spectrum of laboratory measurements from serum and plasma samples is available, including NMR metabolomics. Available genomics data include GWAS (array and imputed genotypes, N>31,000), whole exome sequences (N>12,000), and whole genome sequences (N>5000). FINRISK 2007 includes two follow-up studies: DILGOM 2007 and DILGOM 2014, focused on metabolic diseases.
Sample Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for sample access descriptions
Data Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for data access descriptions

Name: Finnish Mobile Clinic Health Examination Surveys
Description: The Finnish Mobile Clinic Health Examination Surveys in THL Biobank consist of three study cohorts. The Finnish Mobile Clinic Survey conducted in two phases: a baseline health examination with serum and plasma samples of 51 522 donors collected during 1966–1972, and a follow-up study of 19 518 previous participants in 1973–1976. The mobile bus clinics were also utilized in the following Mini-Finland Health Survey in 1978-1980, to collect large amount of health data and serum and plasma samples from over 7000 new participants. The health status of the 1000 participants of the Mini-Finland Survey was followed up 20 years later during the Health 2000 survey, in which DNA sample was also collected. The aim of all surveys was early detection and prevention of chronic diseases and achieve data for epidemiological research. The data consist of extensive amount of health examination data, questionnaire, and interview data as well as physical and laboratory measurements.
Sample Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for sample access descriptions
Data Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for data access descriptions

Name: THL Psychiatric Family Collections
Description: Research cohort includes patients diagnosed with bipolar spectrum disorders (BPD), schizophrenia (SZ) or schizoaffective disorder (FSZ) and their family members. The data consist of a wide range of phenotypes, neurocognitive tests as well as GWAS from all 4000 participants and WES data from 385 sample donors. DNA and B-lymphocyte cell lines (subset) are also available. The BPD family collection include 180 families with patients who were born between 1940 and 1969, had onset of disease before the age of 30, and had two or more hospital admissions due to BPD. The schizophrenia collection consists of 734 families with one or more family member diagnosed with SZ or FSZ. In this collection, patients were born between 1940 and 1976. THL Biobank has restricted the sample and data use of Psychiatric Family Collections to concern only research of psychiatric disorders.
Sample Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for sample access descriptions
Data Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for data access descriptions

Name: Fin-HIT Study
Description: The Finnish Health in Teens Study (Fin-HIT) is a follow-up study from childhood to early adulthood that focuses on the causal relationships between genetic and various lifestyle factors that affect weight and health. Material currently available for biobank research contains > 3000 DNA samples extracted from the saliva samples of 9-12 y old children and their parents as well as selected data on diet, physical activity, body image, sleep and screen time. The follow-up study has been done in three phases; the baseline study in 2011-2014, first follow-up in 2015-2016 and second follow-up in 2020 as the donors entered adulthood. More samples and data will gradually be transferred to THL Biobank when released from the use of the original study. The ongoing study is conducted by the Folkhälsan Research Center, Helsinki, Finland.
Sample Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for sample access descriptions
Data Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for data access descriptions

Name: FinHealth 2017 Study
Description: A health and well-being survey study that involved 6650 randomly selected donors from the adult Finnish population. The data include GWAS and NMR metabolomics data, physical and laboratory measurements as well as extensive amount of self-reported data on lifestyle and health. High-quality DNA, plasma and serum samples collected by the well-defined protocol are also available. The new format of the survey conducted in 2017 combined the two major populations health monitoring surveys of the Finnish Institute for health and Welfare (THL), the Health 2000/2011 and FINRISK surveys, to produce up-to-date information on the health, health behavior, functioning and well-being of adults living in Finland in 2017.
Sample Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for sample access descriptions
Data Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for data access descriptions

Name: Finnish IPF Study
Description: The Finnish IPF cohort includes patients with confirmed diagnosis of idiopatic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF), a progressive lung disease. Currently, DNA and GWAS data from over 300 patients, as well as serum and PBMCs from the subset of patients are available for biobank research via THL Biobank. The Finnish IPF study is a national clinical trial of IPF patients launched at the Helsinki University Central Hospital in 2012. The aim of the ongoing study is to study and monitor the prognosis and course of patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis in a standardized manner, and to investigate the incidence of the disease in Finland. The participants were originally identified from the hospital registers by ICD-10 diagnosis code J84.1 1 (other interstitial pulmonary diseases with fibrosis) and J84.9 (interstitial pulmonary disease). All included patients meet the ATS/ERS statement´s diagnostic criteria for IPF (Raghu et al, Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 2011;183:788–824).
Sample Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for sample access descriptions
Data Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for data access descriptions

Name: Helsinki Heart Study
Description: Samples and data of 4000 middle-aged men (40 to 55 y), collected as part of the five-year clinical trial to test whether the cholesterol-lowering drug Gemfibrozil could reduce the risk of coronary heart disease. All participants had primary dyslipidemia but no previous major illness or coronary heart disease. DNA and GWAS data are available from more than 3500 participants. Data also contains physical and laboratory measurements and questionnaire data on health and lifestyle. The randomized, double-blinded and placebo-controlled trial was conducted during 1981-1990 by KTL, a predecessor to Finnish Institute of Health and Welfare (THL). Due to current high age of the donors, an extensive amount of longitudinal register data can be combined with the research material by the separate permission of the national registry authority, Findata.
Sample Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for sample access descriptions
Data Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for data access descriptions

Name: Mini-Finland Survey (Finnish Mobile Clinic)
Description: Mini-Finland Study's purpose was to create the foundations for a national health monitoring system in Finland. The aim was to conduct versatile and reliable research about population health, need for treatment, and functional capacity. Focus areas included common chronic diseases, i.e. diseases of the circulatory, respiratory and musculoskeletal systems as well as mental disorders. The study was conducted in 40 areas across the country, targeting a sample of 8 000 Finns aged 30 years and over, and it was third main phase of Finnish Mobile Clinic Health Examination Survey. Even in the 2000's the Mini-Finland Study can still be considered a pioneer in Europe in terms of the development of health monitoring systems.
Sample Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for sample access descriptions
Data Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for data access descriptions

Name: Migraine Study
Description: One of the largest family collections of migraine research consisting of more than 9500 participants. The genetic data in THL Biobank includes GWAS data from over 8400 sample donors, WES data from 490 donors and WGS data from more than 600 donors. The DNA samples of the study have been collected since 1992 as part of research collaboration between Helsinki University and Helsinki University Central Hospital. The study includes sample donors diagnosed with migraine and their family-members and aims to detect variation in genes associated with migraine, headache-related symptoms and chronic disease risk factors. The research is still ongoing and new study participants are actively recruited.
Sample Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for sample access descriptions
Data Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for data access descriptions

Name: Finnish SUPER Study
Description: The SUPER Study cohort is a collection of over 9000 Finnish patients diagnosed with psychotic illnesses with ICD-10 diagnostic codes F20-F29, F30.2, F31.2, F31.5, F32.3 and F33.3. The currently available research material in the biobank includes GWAS genomic data (>9000), diagnostic information, and basic information (height, weight, smoking). High-quality DNA, plasma and serum are available from all participants. The Finnish SUPER study is a part of the international Stanley Global Neuropsychiatric Genomics Initiative and was collected during 2015-2018 in Finland. The objective of the still ongoing study is to obtain information on the genetic and biological background of psychotic disorders and promote development of therapeutic interventions. PBMC samples and an extensive amount of data collected by health examinations, interviews and questionnaires will also be gradually available in THL Biobank when released from the original study of the University of Helsinki.
Sample Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for sample access descriptions
Data Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for data access descriptions

Name: THL Biobank cohorts
Description:
THL Biobank is a country-wide biobank that collects and stores valuable research samples from all over Finland. THL Biobank supports research investigating the causes of diseases, research on the impact of the hereditary, environmental and lifestyle factors to diseases, as well as research aiming to develop new solutions for health promotion and disease prevention.

THL Biobank cohorts is a supercollection consisting of all cohorts hosted under THL Biobank administration. Detailed descriptions of each cohort are described in separate cohort cards.
Sample Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for sample access descriptions
Data Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for data access descriptions

Name: THL Diabetes Studies
Description: THL Diabetes cohort is a combination of several diabetes studies conducted in Finland between 1986 and 2013. The cohort consists of samples and data (including GWAS from > 10 000 participants) from more than 13 500 young donors with type 1 diabetes and from their family members. The research cohort consists of sub-studies namely, DIME, IDDMGEN, T1D-GEN and YA/YA-EPID, collected by the Finnish Institute for Health and Welfare (THL) that were focusing on the genetic background and environmental triggers of diabetes in Finland. The material includes DNA (and GWAS data) from most of the donors and plasma/serum and mononuclear cells from the subsets.
Sample Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for sample access descriptions
Data Access Description: Please see the THL Biobank websites for data access descriptions

Name: Twin Study
Description: The Twin study is a large research collection of data and samples from Finnish twins. The Twin study available in THL Biobank consist of DNA samples and GWAS data from more than 14 000 participants as well as longitudinal data collected by questionnaires and interviews covering over three decades. Longitudinal questionnaire and interview data have been collected from twin pairs born before 1958, during 1974-79 and during 1983-87, forming the base cohort of the study. Biological samples have been collected between 1994 and 2017 in the several sub-studies that recruited participants from the base cohort. The data collected in the sub-studies include physiological measurements, laboratory measurements and other omics data that will also be gradually transferred to THL Biobank when released from the original Twin cohort study of the University of Helsinki.

Name: Helsinki Urological Biobank
Description: Helsinki Urological Biobank supports research in the field of urology. It seeks to discover new methods for the better prevention, earlier and more accurate diagnosis, and personalized treatment and follow-up of urological disorders.
Sample Access Description: Samples and data stored in the Helsinki Urological Biobank can be used for research in urological disorders. The HUB Executive Board reviews and evaluates all sample and/or data access applications. If considered necessary, the Executive Board may invite external experts to review the application.
Data Access Description: Please see the Helsinki Biobank websites for material and data access descriptions

Name: Borealis Biobank Blood sample collection
Description: A rapidly growing collection of blood samples (whole blood, serum, plasma, DNA) collected from people who have signed a prospective consent to participate in Biobank Borealis. The serum and plasma fractions are stored in -80°C in 450 µl aliquots and the whole blood in one 2 mL aliquot. DNA is extracted from frozen whole blood samples. Various types of health record data (such as diagnoses in SNOMED or ICD-10 codes, procedures, laboratory values and medications) can be linked to the samples. Sample collection for this cohort is ongoing.
Sample Access Description: Borealis Biobank holds the authority on the use and assignment of the samples and related information it stores for biobank research. The biobank has a scientific management group that assesses in advance the research plan, as well as whether the statutory requirements governing the assignment of the sample have been met. The assignment of a sample requires a positive statement from the biobanks scientific management group. The assignment of samples and their related information is always based on a written agreement with the biobank and the sample receiver organization.
Data Access Description: Please see sample access description

Name: Borealis Biobank Maternity clinic collection
Description: Biobank Borealis is collecting blood samples (whole blood, plasma, serum and DNA) from pregnant women living in Northern Finland. The serum and plasma fractions are stored in -80°C in 450 µl aliquots and the whole blood in one 2 mL aliquot. The sample collection was initiated in 2018 and it is ongoing. Data on newborn children, births and data on the mothers is available.

Name: Borealis Biobank FFPE sample collection
Description: Biobank Borealis FFPE (formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded) tissue sample collection contains almost 1.8 million samples transferred from Pathology department of Oulu University Hospital. The samples have been collected in Northern Finland since the late 1970s. In addition, the pathology archives of central hospital/healthcare districts of Lapland, Länsi-Pohja, Central Ostrobothnia and Kainuu  starting from early 1990s are included. Sample collection for this cohort is still ongoing. Related to the FFPE samples Biobank Borealis offers researchers services in whole slide imaging, digital pathology, TMA block preparation and sample processing services.

Name: Finnish Maternity Cohort
Description: The Finnish Maternity Cohort (FMC) is a unique, accessible biobank collection for epidemiological, biomarker, and surveillance studies. It contains over 2 million serum samples (2,059,000) from 993 000 pregnant women at first trimester. The population-based cohort is collected nationwide and covers over 90% of women in Finland who have been pregnant between 1983-2016. The samples were collected at local maternity care units for routine screening for congenital infections and the remaining samples (1-3 mL) were stored at -25°C for scientific research. For women with multiple pregnancies, serial prediagnostic samples are available. Moreover, there are approximately 100,000 pairs of mothers and daughters, who both have donated sera to the FMC for scientific research. Personal identification codes enable linkage with the nationwide, population-based health registries (such as Finnish Cancer Registry and Medical Birth Register) and establish a unique study base for longitudinal studies.
Sample Access Description: Borealis Biobank holds the authority on the use and assignment of the samples and related information it stores for biobank research. Name: FCBT Blood Samples Collection
Description: The blood sample collection includes EDTA whole blood, EDTA plasma and serum samples. Blood samples have been collected from 2016 to 2022 from about 46,000 different individuals.Of the EDTA whole blood samples, some are assorted for DNA extraction. DNA is extracted from a frozen sample and there are currently extracted DNA samples from about 37,000 individuals. From extracted DNA samples there exists a storage tube (volume 270-320 µl), whose DNA concentration may vary. In addition, there are 1-3 normalized aliquot tubes (50 µg/µl) with volumes ranging from 80 to 500 µl. Some of the EDTA whole blood samples (N=9000) have been preserved as whole blood, with volume ranging 800-2700 µl. Serum and plasma samples have been collected using the cold chain, i.e. stored and processed at +4 °C from collection to storage. All samples are first stored at -75 °C and long-term storage occurs in liquid nitrogen tanks (-196 °C).

Name: FCBT Cerebrospinal Fluid Samples Collection
Description: The Cerebrospinal fluid (CFS) collection includes CSF samples collected during diagnostics and serum samples (matching serums) taken at the same sampling time. In the collection, there is currently CSF samples from  150 different individuals and serum samples from 350 different individuals. CFS samples accumulate in the biobank from about 15 individuals and serum samples from about 35 individuals per month. After sampling, the samples are frozen and stored at -75 °C. In the biobank, samples are thawed and centrifuged at + 4 °C, and the supernatant are divided into aliquots (volume 200-450 µl). The aliquots are re-frozen and stored at -75 °C. The sample collection was initiated in September 2021 and is still ongoing.

Name: FCBT Fresh Frozen Tissue Samples Collection
Description: High-quality collection of fresh frozen tissue samples of different types of cancer, preserved by instant freezing fresh in isopentane and then under controlled conditions at -75 °C. The cold ischemia time of samples is routinely monitored and representativeness of the samples is verified by the pathologist. The four most represented disease groups are: Urological cancer (N=250), breast cancer (N=250), gastrological cancer (N=80), gynecological cancer (N=80). CtDNA samples (N=1 300) are plasma samples collected from cancer patients during the collection of fresh frozen tissue samples. ctDNA samples have been collected before surgery, with the somatic mutations and epigenetic changes characteristic of the cancer still remaining in the patient's blood. In addition to plasma, buffycoat and red blood cell fraction are segregated from the samples.
Sample Access Description: Finnish Clinical Biobank Tampere (FCBT) holds the authority on the use and assignment of the samples and related information it stores for biobank research. Name: FCBT Clinical Genetics Samples Collection
Description: The sample collection includes diagnostic blood, cell and tissue samples from about 10,000 individuals, totaling about 30,000 samples. Cell and tissue samples are collected for genetics diagnostics and counselling, and bone marrow and blood samples taken from patients with malignant blood diseases. Genetic studies are conducted to seek, refine a diagnosis, or establish susceptibility to disease. Some of the sample material contains isolated DNA and RNA, as well as cells. For example mononuclear cells can withstand decades of storage and are useful starting material for protein, DNA and RNA studies. The samples have been collected over the period from January 1, 1990 to August 31, 2013, and the collection will move to the biobank in stages by 2025.Sample Types: Bone Marrow, Blood, Amniotic Fluid, Placenta, Tissue and Tumor.Sample formats and storage temperatures: DNA (-80 °C), RNA (-80 °C), Mononuclear cells (-80 °C), Tissue fragments (-80 °C), Cultured cells (-196 °C).

Name: FCBT Maternity Clinic Samples Collection
Description: The sample collection includes EDTA whole blood, EDTA plasma and serum samples collected in maternity clinics collected from mothers living in Finland during their pregnancies. Samples are taken from pregnant women during 1 trimester, i.e. by the beginning of 14 weeks of pregnancy. Now the sample collection contains samples from more than 3 800 different individuals. All samples are first stored at -75 °C and long-term storage occurs in liquid nitrogen tanks (-196 °C). The samples have been collected over the period from March 1, 2019 to June 31, 2022.

Name: FCBT FFPE Tissue Samples Collection
Description: The sample collection contains a large number of histological samples collected at Tampere University Hospital since 1963.The collection contains tumor samples taken or removed in connection with tumor diagnostics and cancer. In addition, the sample material exhibits various precancerous changes, inflammatory changes, reactive changes, and tissue samples belonging to normal variation. Histological specimens have mainly been treated with formalin and cast in paraffin (FFPE). The collection includes FFPE tissue samples from more than 400,000 individuals, forming a collection of more than 3.4 million diagnostic tissue samples. Of the samples, c. 8% (N=270,000) are cancer samples. FFPE samples are stored in a dry environment at room temperature in compliance with the diagnostics requirements of Fimlab Laboratories Pathology Unit.

Name: Northern Finland Birth Cohort 1966
Description: Northern Finland Birth Cohort 1966 (NFBC1966) is a prospective birth cohort initiated in the 1960s to examine risk factors involved in pre-term birth and intrauterine growth retardation, and the consequences on subsequent morbidity. Mothers with expected dates of delivery between 1.1. -31.12.1966 were recruited from the two northernmost provinces in Finland. At baselin a total of 12,231 children were included. Several follow-up studies (1y, 14y, 31y and 46y) have been performed with clinical examinations in 1997-98 (31y) and 2012-13 (46y).

Data Access Description: Please see the Artic Biobank websites for data access descriptions

Name: Northern Finland Birth Cohort 1986
Description: Northern Finland Birth Cohort 1986 (NFBC1986) is a prospective cohort, which included mothers in the two northernmost provinces on Finland (Oulu and Lapland) with an expected date of birth between 1.7.1985 and 30.6.1986. Altogether, 9 432 live-born children were included at baseline. Data has been collected on delivery, and at 1, 7-8, 15-16 and 33-35 years of age. Clinical examinations in 2001-02 and 2019-20 (15-16y, 33-35y).

Name: Oulu 1935 study
Description: Oulu 1935 is prospective population-based cohort study conducted in 1990–2017 assessing the prevalence of type 2 diabetes and glucose abnormalities. All inhabitants of the city of Oulu, Finland, born in 1935 and living in Oulu on 1st October 1990 (N = 1008), were invited to baseline study.

Name: CADASIL_NEPSYBANK
Description: The NEPSYBANK is a specific collection of samples (DNA, RNA, primer fibroblasts, tissue) collected from our patients living with CADASIL. The phenotype, clinical data and social-economic information of attached patients are also part of NEPSYBANK. These samples are stored at -80 ° C , -20° C and in liquid nitrogen tanks as well. We apply a smartbank IT system, too. On the other hand it is also a disease specific biobank being a whole genom database of few hundred patients we treat in the Institute of Genomic Medicine and Rare Disorders of Semmelweis University, Budapest.

Name: NEGTAR of Semmelweis University
Description: The NEGTAR is a specific collection of samples (DNA, RNA, blood, tissue) collected from our patients reached an elder age having good health and whole life without any serious disease or morbidity. These samples are stored at -80 ° C , -20° C and in liquid nitrogen tanks as well. We apply a smartbank IT system, too. The base of our NEGTAR is given by the samples of approximately 100 healthy elder persons with their whole genom database.

Name: SCHIZObank_SCHIZOBANK
Description: SCHIZOBANK is a special, disease-based biobank that has the permission of the local ethics committee to maintain its collection with different types of biological materials of patients relating. With the aid of this biobank we try to releive the background of this psychiatric disorder at the molecular level. Data of SCHIZOBANK (based on the results of our investigations) contain biomarkers that help diagnosing, monitoring of drugs’ effects and eliminating adverse side effects individually. The collection of SCHIZOBANK is a specific collection of samples (DNA, RNA, serum) collected from our patients living with the mentioned disorder. The phenotype, clinical data and social-economic information of attached patients are also part of SCHIZOBANK. These samples are stored at -70° C.
Sample Access Description: Please, in case you need further information, contact directly: fodor.andras@med.semmelweis-univ.hu!
Data Access Description: Please, in case you need further information, contact directly: fodor.andras@med.semmelweis-univ.hu!
Image Access Description: Please, in case you need further information, contact directly: fodor.andras@med.semmelweis-univ.hu!

Name: PEDBANK
Description: The PEDBANK is a specific collection of samples collected from children. The medical history and social-economic information of attached patients are also part of PEDBANK. These samples are stored at -80 ° C.
Biobank Label: Biobank and Database Core Facility UOP SZKK

Name: PEDBANK COHORT
Description: The PEDBANK Cohort is a specific collection of samples (serum) collected from healthy children. The medical history and social-economic information of attached patients are also part of PEDBANK. These samples are stored at -80 ° C.
Sample Access Description: Please, contact in case you need further information, personal contact: regina.felso@pte.hu.
Data Access Description: Please, contact in case you need further information, personal contact: regina.felso@pte.hu.
Biobank Label: Biobank and Database Core Facility UOP SZKK

Name: IARC cell lines collection
Description: Burkitt lymphoma cell lines established at IARC in 80’s from cancer patients and characterized (EBV status and cytogenetics)
Sample Access Description:
The mission of IARC includes promoting cancer research internationally. As a publicly funded international organization with a mandate for collaborative research, IARC wishes to ensure that biospecimens stored within the Agency are being put to the best possible use. Within this context, the samples stored at IARC are available for research projects consistent with IARC’s scientific goals and the IARC/WHO legal and ethical standard practices. 
The principle of access means that samples and data entrusted to the Agency should be put to best possible scientific use taking into account the best interest of the participants and for public benefit
Data Access Description: The decision on fees and/or potential for joint project would be considered on a case by case basis.

Name: Hereditary Colorectal Cancers
Description: Colorectal cancer is the third cancer and the second most common cause of cancer death worldwide, with an estimated 800,000 deaths in 2018. Within the CRC totals, 80% is represented by sporadic forms, about 10% by hereditary ones, while about 20-30% is represented by family forms. In hereditary forms, the alteration of a single gene, transmitted through the germline, causes a marked familial predisposition to the development of colorectal cancer. Among these, familial polyposis syndromes (FAP) are a very heterogeneous group of rare diseases that, overall, account for about 1% of all CRCs. Hereditary non-polyposis colorectal cancer (HNPCC) or Lynch syndrome is an autosomal dominant inherited syndrome with a high to medium degree of penetrance (30-70%). . Both FAP and HNPCC are stored in the CLINICA CHIRURGICA I TUMOUR TISSUE BIOBANK as a separate collection..

Name: Moli-sani project
Description: Moli-sani involved over 24,000 adult citizens residing in Molise. The Moli-sani biobank (Moli-bank) contains about one million samples and stores, in liquid nitrogen, serum, plasma, buffy-coat/DNA, urine samples (at -80 ° C) and collects anamnestic, chemical-clinical, socio-economic and lifestyle information of the adult subjects recruited. Gene/environment interactions are studied to evaluate risk/protection factors (environmental, genetic or dietary) for the development of cardiovascular, neurodegenerative and tumor diseases. Anamnestic data and follow-up samples from more than 2000 subjects are also available. Follow-up is ongoing.
Sample Access Description: Submission of a collaborative proposal through a specific form to the scientific commitee of the Moli-sani project.
Data Access Description: Submission of a collaborative proposal through a specific form to the scientific commitee of the Moli-sani project.

Name: Neuromed COVID-19
Description: The biobank stores biological samples of patients with COVID-19 and of subjects with immunoserological positivity to Sars-Cov2

Name: Telethon project
Description: Moli-family is a Telethon-funded study aimed at evaluating the genetic component of juvenile heart attack. Serum, citrate plasma, EDTA plasma and buffy coat of 900 subjects belonging to 54 families (3 generations) selected from a proband with a heart attack under the age of 50 and a first degree relative with ischemic vascular disease before the age of 60 or a proband of a family in which cardiovascular disease has never occurred
Sample Access Description: Submission of a collaborative proposal through a specific form to the scientific commitee of project
Data Access Description: Submission of a collaborative proposal through a specific form to the scientific commitee of project

Name: PLATONE Project
Description: Platone (Integrated Health Life Platform) collects and stores at the moment, only buffy coat samples of hospitalized patients for any diagnosis, in the clinics belonging to the Neuromed group, thus creating a network between the structures belonging to the CRB.
Sample Access Description: Submission of a collaborative proposal through a specific form to the scientific commitee of the project
Data Access Description: Submission of a collaborative proposal through a specific form to the scientific commitee of the project

Name: PReFace
Description: Preface (Risk factors and prediction of surgical outcome in lumbar spinal stenosis) Studies the factors that can increase the risk of lumbar stenosis, worsen its clinical course or affect the outcome of surgery. The collected samples of serum, EDTA plasma and buffy coat, stored in the Preface Bank come from subjects admitted to the IRCCS Neuromed center to undergo surgery for lumbar stenosis.

Name: IPSYS
Description: IPSYS (Italian Project on Stroke in Young adultS) The purpose of this collection is to identify the genetic and environmental factors that can increase the risk of a first cerebral ischemic stroke and of a second thrombotic event in young adults (18 to 45 years old).

Name: IMMIDIET
Description: IMMIDIET EC-funded research focused on Italian emigrants to Belgium. Many remained in their new country, assimilating new habits. An ideal situation to evaluate the role of genetic, hereditary, and acquired factors on the risk of cardiovascular disease.

Name: Athena
Description: ATHENA (AnTHocyanin and polyphenol bioactives for Health Enhancement through Nutritional Advancement) project, supported by the European Union (FP7), stems from an observational study suggesting that moderate wine consumption reduced the side-effects of radiation therapy (RT) in patients with breast cancer. Such protective effect could be due to the non-alcoholic fraction of wine, rich in anti-inflammatory polyphenols, such as anthocyanins.

Name: moli-sani follow-up
Description: Moli-sani involved over 24,000 adult citizens residing in Molise. Moli-sani collects anamnestic, chemical-clinical, socio-economic and lifestyle information of the adult subjects recruited. Gene/environment interactions are studied to evaluate risk/protection factors (environmental, genetic or dietary) for the development of cardiovascular, neurodegenerative and tumor diseases. Anamnestic data and follow-up samples from more than 3000 subjects are also available. Follow-up is ongoing.

Name: MEDPAD
Description: MedPad (Mediterranean diet and Peripheral Arterial Disease) Studies the relationship between the Mediterranean diet, its antioxidant content and the risk of Peripheral Arterial Disease. Collects serum, EDTA plasma and buffy coat samples from patients admitted to the IRCCS Neuromed center.

Name: medicea
Description: Medicea (Adherence to the Mediterranean diet and malignant brain tumors) Studies the relationship between the Mediterranean diet, its antioxidant content and the risk of brain tumors, as well as the prognosis and quality of life of patients with these tumors. Collects serum, EDTA plasma and buffy coat samples from patients admitted to the IRCCS Neuromed center.

Name: Biobank of Veterinary Resources
Description: The Biobank of Veterinary Resources (BVR), located at the Istituto Zooprofilattico Sperimentale della Lombardia e dell’Emilia Romagna (IZSLER), has the mission to collect biological resources mainly resulting from routinely diagnostic procedures and research. The collected resources, stored after being submitted to careful identity and purity controls, are available to public and private institutions.. The collection consists of several types of biological samples such as cell culture, pathogens (viruses, bacteria, parassites), histological material and microorganism genomic sequences, etc.. Biological resources from third parties can be stored at BVR facilities as safe deposit, open deposit and patent deposit according to Budapest treaty.. The Biobank is certified according to ISO 9001:2015 and UNI CEI EN ISO/IEC 17025.. Furthermore, BVR has been recognized as an Office Internationale Epizooties (OIE) Collaborating Centre for Veterinary Biological Resources..

Name: Biobanca  Neurologica
Description: BioNeuro is one of the collections of CRB-HSM. It includes:. . - cerebrospinal liquid from patients affected by neurodegenerative diseases (Alzheimer's Disease, Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease, Frontotemporal Dementia). . - cerebrospinal liquid from patients affected by inflammatory disorders of the central nervous system (CIS, multiple sclerosis, acute, subacute and chronic inflammatory polyneuropathies). . - biopsies of sural nerve of patients with neuropathies of different origin.
Sample Access Description: sign the CRB-HSM MTA
Data Access Description: sign the CRB-HSM MTA
Biobank Label: Centro Risorse Biologiche IRCCS Ospedale Policlinico San Martino

Name: Banca cellule ICLC
Description: The collection includes the Interlab Cell Line Collection (ICLC), the European Collection for Biomedical Research (ECBR) and  the International Deposit Authority (IDA).. . Born in 1994, the collection became soon a point of reference for academical and industrial researchers, to whom it supplies: . . •human and animal cell lines, mainly of tumoral origin, of certified quality (on-line catalogue). . •quality control service, detection of mycoplasma. . •identification service: authentication of human cell lines through STR profile and/or HLA profile. . •information and technical-scientific support on cell line availability at the international level, functional features, transport of biological samples. . •safe deposit for tissue samples, cell lines and hybridomas. . • patent deposit of cell lines and hybridomas: International Deposit Authority (IDA) under the Budapest Treaty.. .
Sample Access Description: Fill in the order form and the agreement form, and send by mail, together with the official order from your institute, to the ICLC secretariat.
Data Access Description: Fill in the order form and the agreement form, and send by mail, together with the official order from your institute, to the ICLC secretariat.
Biobank Label: Centro Risorse Biologiche IRCCS Ospedale Policlinico San Martino

Name: Biobanca di Tessuto Liquidi Biologici e DNA
Description: BTLB is one of the three collections of the CRB-HSM biobank. It includes:. . - FFPE and crio-preserved tissues  from tumors (mainly breast, lung, colon), whole blood, serum, plasma, nucleic acids, urine, saliva, blood cell fractions. . - DNA from lymphoprolipherative disorders. . - biopsies from abdominal aorta, carotid, safena.
Sample Access Description: sign the CRB-POLIGE MTA
Data Access Description: sign the CRB-POLIGE MTA
Biobank Label: Centro Risorse Biologiche IRCCS Ospedale Policlinico San Martino

Name: Biobanca COVID
Description: The collection includes residual samples from the COVID diagnostic activity of the Policlinico
Sample Access Description: Access based upon common projects, through DTA
Data Access Description: Access based upon common projects, through MTA
Biobank Label: Centro Risorse Biologiche IRCCS Ospedale Policlinico San Martino

Name: B.B.O.P.
Description: The Paediatric Oncology BioBank (B.B.O.P.) is aimed at the collection, analysis, conservation and distribution of biological samples relating to paediatric oncological pathologies (leukaemia and non-leukaemia), for the purpose of advanced diagnosis of paediatric oncological pathology and scientific research.. The B.B.O.P. proposes to: to enable the diagnosis of paediatric patients suffering from paediatric oncological pathologies through the analysis of samples belonging to the Paediatric Oncohaematology Laboratory of Padua, and the integration of clinical, morphological, cytofluorimetric and molecular data, thus providing important information for the most suitable treatment of the patient to facilitate scientific research, providing researchers with data relevant for their research and with samples..
Sample Access Description: The B.B.O.P. collects and integrates biological samples and all data (clinical, morphological, cytofluorimetric and molecular) of patients in a dedicated database in oracle, defining the clinical, diagnostic and prognostic profile of the patient

Name: Collection all samples
Description: The most representative disorders are:. Genetic disorders affecting the metabolism and the white matter . Chromosome disorders (Down s., Ring chromosome 14 s., Cri du chat s. and Isodicentric 15 chromosome). Neurological diseases (Fragile X s., Mowat Wilson s. and Dravet s.). Rare bone diseases (Crouzon s., Achondroplasia, and Thanathophoric dwarfism). Overgrowth syndromes (Sotos s.)
Sample Access Description: Sample request management is fully handled through the IT infrastructure shared by all the TNGB partners. . Users can select the samples of interest by browsing the TNGB catalogue available at http://biobanknetwork. telethon.it/. Users online registration is mandatory to submit requests of samples. All requests are collected in a Request Control Panel where all biobank directors (i.e., Network Board) can review the requests on the basis of the access rules and priority criteria stated in the TNGB Charter. Once the request has been approved by the Network Board, the TNGB coordination office assigns it to the sample-holding biobank’s staff, who will send a “Material Transfer Agreement” form for acceptance of the TNGB policy..
Data Access Description: Sample request management is fully handled through the IT infrastructure shared by all the TNGB partners. . Users can select the samples of interest by browsing the TNGB catalogue available at http://biobanknetwork. telethon.it/. Users online registration is mandatory to submit requests of samples. Name: Breast Cancer
Description: A collection of samples (serum, urine) collected between 2008 and 2010 within a research project on breast cancer metabolomic by NMR have been transferred to the biobank in 2012. Samples from 60 healthy donors are part of the collection.
Sample Access Description: After browsing the public daVEB database at the link https://www.davincieuropeanbiobank.org/public_search/davebtables/search.html, applicants should  contact the biobank to get more information,and then fill in a form describing types and number of the required samples, scientific project, project sustainability, expected results, ethics aspects etc.. . The daVEB Technical and Scientific Committee and Ethics Committee will consider the proposed study for approval, referring to the original authorization to sample transfer in the daVEB repository. In the scientific evaluation of the project, if necessary, it is foreseen to consult external referees. In case of positive evaluation, an economic quotation is sent (covering shipping and partial cost recovery). No patient samples or data are sold for profit.

Description: Samples (serum and urine) from patients affected by different cardiomyopathies (originating from myocarditis, chemotherapy, diabetes, ischaemia, or idiopathic) have been collected in the period 2010-2013, following SOPs specific for metabolic studies by 1H-NMR.. . Samples have been processed according to CEN/TS 16945:2016 standards (Molecular in vitro diagnostic examinations - Specifications for pre-examination processes for metabolomics in urine, venous blood and plasma).

Samples from 312 controls are part of the collection.

Name: Haematological cancer
Description: Two collections of DNA samples collected within different research projects on haematological cancer have been transferred to the biobank respectively in 2010 (from 41 patients affected by Non-Hodgkin'slymphoma and their bone marrow donors, enrolled between 2001 and 2006) and 2015 (from 159 donors, enrolled between 1998 and 2005) samples of the second group have been collected from patients affected by different types of haematological cancer, e.g., follicular lymphoma, mantle cell lymphoma, Hodgkin's lymphoma, chronic lymphocytic leukemia, small lymphocytic lymphoma, non Hodgkin's lymphoma, etc.
Sample Access Description: After browsing the directory, applicants should contact the biobank to get more information, and then fill in a form describing types and number of the required samples, scientific project, project sustainability, expected results, ethics aspects etc. The daVEB Technical and Scientific Committee and Ethics Committee will consider the proposed study for approval, referring to the original authorization to sample transfer in the daVEB repository. In the scientific evaluation of the project, if necessary, it is foreseen to consult external referees. In case of positive evaluation, an economic quotation is sent (covering shipping and partial cost recovery). No patient samples or data are sold for profit.
Data Access Description: As for access to biological samples.

Name: Skeletal muscle-peripheral nerve-DNA-cell cultures-resin-embedded samples for electron microscopy
Description: The Biobank of skeletal muscle peripheral nerve DNA and cell cultures is part of the Rare Neuromuscular Disease Unit. It collects and stores biological samples for both research and diagnostic purposes.. . Since 1999 it has been partly funded by the Telethon Foundation as part of the Telethon Network of Genetic Biobanks.. . In 2002 it became a partner of the project EuroBioBank funded by the European Community coordinated by Eurordis first (European Organization for Rare Diseases ) and currently by Telethon. It joined BBMRI in 2013.. . The Bank’s quality system is certified by BVQI.. . The Biobank contains a considerable number of biological samples from patients with different rare neuromuscular diseases. It currently stores over 6400 skeletal muscle specimens, approximately 5140 resin-embedded samples for electron microscopy observation, over 200 samples of peripheral nerve for morphological studies and 8117 of DNA samples and cell cultures.. .
Biobank Label: Biobank of skeletal muscle peripheral nerve DNA and cell cultures

Name: Cell line and DNA Bank of Genetic Movement Disorders and Mitochondrial Diseases
Description: The biobank provides samples as a service to the scientific community conducting research on movement disorders and mitochondrial diseases. Different types of biomaterials are available from a single patient (DNA and fibroblasts. The Biobank is founding partner of the EuroBioBank network, the first operating network of biobanks for rare diseases in Europe, and of the Italian Telethon Network of Genetic Biobanks
Biobank Label: Cell lines and DNA bank of  Genetic Movement Disorders and Mitochondrial Diseases

Name: Biobanca Urological Research Institute (URI)
Description: Born in 2010, the Biobank of URI includes a collection of samples from patients with non-oncological and oncological diseases in the fields of urology and andrology. Currently, the collected materials are represented by solid tissues (from prostate, kidney, bladder and testicular benign and malignant disorders) and liquid tissues (including serum, plasma, cells isolated from peripheral blood, urine, semen, feces and mucosal swab). The Biobank also contains liquid tissues from healthy volunteers.. The main contacts for the URBBANN are: Prof. Andrea Salonia, Director, URI-Urological Research Institute (salonia.andrea@hsr.it) Dr. Anna Maria Ferrara, URBBAN coordinator (ferrara.annamaria@hsr.it).
Biobank Label: Centro Risorse Biologiche – Ospedale San Raffaele

Name: Biobanca Neoplasie Ematologiche
Description: Born in 2009, the EmaBank includes collection of samples from patients with hematological malignancies (leukemia, multiple myeloma and lymphoma) at diagnosis, relapse and during their follow-up after chemotherapy or bone marrow transplantation. Currently the collected material include cells isolated from peripheral blood and bone marrow, serum, plasma and liquor.
Biobank Label: Centro Risorse Biologiche – Ospedale San Raffaele

Name: Biobanca Tumori Neuroendocrini
Description: Born in 2014, the NETBANK includes collection of samples from patients with gastro-entero-pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors, pulmonary neuroendocrine tumors, neuroendocrine tumors of the thyroid gland, thymus and paraganglioma, neuroendocrine tumors with unknown origin and neuroendocrine tumors associated with genetic mutations. Currently the collected material include pre- and post- operative samples of serum and plasma.
Biobank Label: Centro Risorse Biologiche – Ospedale San Raffaele

Name: Biobanca Malattie infiammatorie croniche
Description: Born in 2014, the MIC BANK collection includes samples from patients with systemic lupus erythematosus (LES), Antiphospholipid syndrome (APAS), vasculitis, scleroderma, systemic sclerosis, reumathoid arthritis, IgG4-related diseases, autoimmune diseases during pregnancy and autoimmune myocarditis. Currently the collected material include cells isolated from peripheral blood, serum and plasma.
Biobank Label: Centro Risorse Biologiche – Ospedale San Raffaele

Name: Biobanca Institute of Experimental Neurology (INSPE)
Description: The Institute of Experimental Neurology (INSPE) constitutes one of the major European institutes primarily dedicated to translational research in the neuroscience field. INSPE includes both the Neurological Department of Ospedale San Raffaele that collect samples from patients with neuroimmunological disorders as multiple sclerosis, neuromuscular disorders as inherited neuropathies as well as muscular dystrophies and motor neuron diseases as amyothrophic lateral sclerosis and research laboratories.
Biobank Label: Centro Risorse Biologiche – Ospedale San Raffaele

Name: COVID-19 Biobank
Description: The COVID-19 Biobank (COVID-BioB) was agreed upon with the overall aim of characterizing patients with SARS-CoV-2 infection and creating a biobank to identify predictors of disease severity, mortality and treatment response. Born in March 2021, COVID-BioB includes collection of samples from patients with suspected or proven acute SARS-CoV-2 infection at diagnosis, at exitus/discharge and during their follow-up after hospital discharge. The COVID-BioB collects a comprehensive range of biological samples, including living peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMC), serum, plasma, buffy coat and pellet PB for DNA/RNA extraction, oropharyngeal secretion, sputum, stool and urine. Furthermore, residual specimens from diagnostic laboratories are collected. This allows to increase the quantity of available material and to expand the range of biospecimens collected (e.g. pleural fluid, bronchoalveolar lavage fluid, cerebrospinal fluid obtained during diagnostic procedures).
Biobank Label: Centro Risorse Biologiche – Ospedale San Raffaele

Name: Biobanca Diabetes Research Institute (DRI)
Description: Born in 2019, the Biobank of Diabetes Research Institute (BioDRI) was established for the collection and storage of human biological material to support research activities aimed at advancing scientific knowledge on pancreatic, autoimmune and metabolic diseases. All biological samples are identified by a unique identification code, stored in barcoded matrix tubes, and obtained, upon signed consent, from healthy or diseased donors, both adults and children. Currently the collected material include serum, plasma, peripheral blood mononuclear cells, whole blood and pancreatic cyst fluid.
Biobank Label: Centro Risorse Biologiche – Ospedale San Raffaele

Name: onocological Samples
Description: The  collection of pathological tissues and, where available, of the corresponding normal tissue began in 2006 with an average recruitment of about 1300 cases / year. These are tissues from 16,000 patients with  various tumor diseases (30% breast. 18% colorectal, 16% sarcomas, 5% head and neck, 7% teguments, 7% lung, 6% female genital system. 3% lymphatic system, 5% urinary tract, 2% male genital tract) undergoing surgery. Since 2012, plasma, serum, whole blood and buffy coat samples have been collected, processed and stored from about 8000 patients with gynecological (20%), mammary (60%) and soft tissue sarcomas (15%) tumors. All tissue and blood material is stored in -80 ° C freezers.

Name: Collection all Samples
Description: The biobank provides samples as a service to the scientific community conducting research on neuromuscular disorders. Samples are from patients affected by different forms of muscular dystrophy, including the severe congenital and Duchenne muscular dystrophies, as well as limb girdle muscular dystrophies, congenital myopathies, distal and myofibrillar myopathies, inflammatory myopathies, and metabolic myopathies. Different types of biomaterials are frequently available from a single patient. . The Biobank is founding partner of the EuroBioBank network, the first operating network of biobanks for rare diseases in Europe, and of the Italian Telethon Network of Genetic Biobanks.

Name: BioBanca Istituzionale
Description: A regional platform for future innovative treatments of oncological pathologies through collection / storage / management of biological samples

Name: BIObanca GENetica
Description: Biobank for Genetic Samples (BIOGEN) is established in 2013 and is connected with 4 related diseases registries. The collection. of samples starts since 2008.nBIOGEN collect high-quality biological materials and merges sample collection with Clinical and. Molecular Data of patients affected by rare skeletal diseases in order to improve diagnosis, research and treatment.nBiogen. collect different biospecimens includes human blood samples, DNA, RNA, serum, tissues.nBIOGEN can offer: sample collection,. DNA extraction and quantification, long-time storage, and distribution. BIOGEN acts in collaboration with the patients’ associations. and Networks (BBMRI-ERIC and TNGB)
Sample Access Description: The researcher makes a request via email with the appropriate format by entering information about the project and the samples, the request is received centrally by the CRB’s CG. . BIOGEN samples also according to TNGB policies: The researcher consults the online catalogue and enters the request through the site by entering information about the project and the samples, the request is received centrally and assessed by the Access Committee. . When the request is approved the specific biobank proceeds with the stipulation of the MTA and shipment. .

Name: Italung
Description: Italung is a lung cancer screening trial with low-dose CT; it is a randomized controlled trial aiming to assess whether annual LDCT examination for 4 years decreases lung cancer mortality compared with usual care in smokers and former smokers. The study targets the recruitment of asymptomatic individuals with a high risk of developing lung cancer. The collection includes aliquotes from blood samples and from sputum samples.
Biobank Label: Biobanca del Laboratorio Regionale Prevenzione Oncologica di ISPRO

Name: Biobanca delle Artriti Reumatoidi
Description:
Rheumatoid arthritis is a chronic inflammatory autoimmune disease. The RA-BioBank was established in 2014 with the aim of
collecting a large amount of biological samples to promote large-scale and high-quality basic and clinical research studies that can
help to better understand this disease and improve its treatments. The Biobank is associated with the Registry of Rheumatological
Diseases and Treatments of the Emilia-Romagna Region, which collect all the clinical and therapeutic data of patients with
rheumatoid arthritis in an electronic archive. The whole blood, plasma and serum samples stored within the Ra-BioBank are
available for serum biomarkers detection and genomic studies

Name: Biobanca IRCCS Centro San Giovanni Di Dio Fatebenefratelli
Description: The BioBank FBF main goal is to provide human biological for studies aimed to 1) investigate genetic causes for neurodegenerative and psychiatric disorders 2) identify molecular marker for neurodegenerative and psychiatric disorders 3) to carry out cellular and molecular biology studies to highlight the pathogenetic mechanism underlying neurodegenerative and psychiatric disorders. Currently the collected material includes samples of DNA, RNA, plasma, serum, cerebrospinal fluid and primary fibroblasts cultures. The biological material was collected from more than 10000 patients affected by the major neuropsychiatric disorders (e.g. Alzheimer's disease, Frontotemporal dementia, vascular dementia, mild cognitive impairment, major depression, bipolar disorder, schizophrenia) and more than 1500 control subjects (cognitively healthy subjects and subjects with no psychiatric disorders) matched for age and gender with patients.
Biobank Label: Biobanca IRCCS Istituto Centro San Giovanni Di Dio Fatebenefratelli

Name: Biobanca per la ricerca Bruno Boerci
Description: From the date of inauguration, more than 3000 samples of biological tissues (Right and Tumor Tissue, Blood, Plasma, PBMCs) have been collected, stored and characterized at the Biobank Bruno Boerci (for each sample is also available the paraffin tissue). . . These samples come from more than 1500 patients who have freely decided to donate to the Biobank part of the biological material in excess of the diagnosis.. . The Biobank Bruno Boerci is proposed as a valuable and irreplaceable source of biological material for researchers, to further our understanding of the clinical and biological features of cancer and to offer an opportunity for medical development, directing efforts towards a more personalized therapy.
Sample Access Description: Whoever would like to have access to the samples of the Bruno Boerci Oncological Biobank could send an email to the Biobank Manager (Prof. Fabio Corsi), by submitting the scientific project.
Data Access Description: Whoever would like to have access to the samples of the Bruno Boerci Oncological Biobank could send an email to the Biobank Manager (Prof. Fabio Corsi), by submitting the scientific project.
Biobank Label: Biobanca per la ricerca Bruno Boerci

Name: Biobanca Oncologica Bruno Boerci
Description: The activity provided by the "Biobanking and biospecimen research" project, supported by the Bruno Boerci ONLUS Foundation, has guaranteed over the years the continuation of the collection and implementation of samples and associated clinical data at the Biobank, increasing its potential in developing cancer screening, prevention and monitoring programs, storing blood (whole blood, plasma, PBMCs) and tissue samples (tumor and normal tissue) from patients affected by different tumor pathologies and usable for genetic and molecular studies.
Sample Access Description: The request for samples by external groups / structures can be made by using the appropriate form, after contact of the Head of the Biobank (by email).
Data Access Description: The request for data, for projects approved by the Ethics Committee, can be made by contacting of the Head of the Biobank.
Biobank Label: Biobanca per la ricerca Bruno Boerci

Name: Biobanca Covid Bruno Boerci

During COVID-19 world emergency, the Biobank Bruno Boerci for research has given its contribution by collecting, processing and
storing SARS-COV-2 positive patients samples, guaranteeing biological material and associated clinical data available for future research.

Name: Banca Biologica di Ricerca Cardiovascolare-Istituto di Ricerche Farmacologiche Mario Negri IRCCS
Description: La Biobanca Saturne fa parte del Centro di Risorse Biologiche dell’Istituto Mario Negri, certificato UNI EN ISO 9001:2015. All’interno di essa sono conservati campioni biologici (sangue, plasma, siero, urina, liquor, feci) raccolti durante studi clinici farmacologici nell’ambito delle malattie cardiovascolari (insufficienza cardiaca, infarto miocardico acuto, fibrillazione atriale, cardiochirurgia, diabete mellito) della terapia intensiva (sepsi, trauma cranico, neurochirurgia) e delle malattie rare (angiomi cavernosi cerebrali). L’ambizione della biobanca è contribuire alla scoperta e allo sviluppo clinico di biomarcatori che consentiranno di migliorare la diagnosi precoce e la cura dei pazienti affetti da queste malattie. È presente anche una sezione in cui sono conservati campioni di sangue utilizzabili a fini di ricerca sugli aspetti genetici delle malattie cardiovascolari, prevenienti da pazienti con scompenso cardiaco o infarto del miocardio e da soggetti sani.
Sample Access Description: Material transfer agreements need to be implemented.

Biobank Label: Banca Biologica di Ricerca Cardiovascolare-Istituto di Ricerche Farmacologiche Mario Negri IRCCS

Name: Abdominopelvic Surgery Biobank collection
Description: The CAP-B4MED collects, catalogues and stores biological samples that are non-essential for diagnostic purposes from patients who provide informed consent for the use of their tissues for research purposes. A direct pipeline with the operating theatres for the collection of tissue samples ensures negligible sample degradation. Surgically-excised pathological and non-pathological tissue samples, serum, total blood, are collected and stored according to specific protocols and standard operating procedures. In addition tissue samples from biopsies are collected.
Sample Access Description: The IEO biobank also plays a key supporting role in internal and external research project and clinical trials. The collection and distribution of Biological Samples and related data must have prior approval from the Scientific Committee (CTO), by the Ethics Committee (CE) and in some cases by the director of the biobank together with the executive coordinator. Everything is described accurately in the Biobank Regulations.

Name: Cooperative Healt Reserch in South Tyrol Collection
Description: The CHRIS study is a population-based study with a longitudinal lookout aimed at investigating the molecular basis of common chronic conditions associated with human ageing, and their interaction with life-style and environmental factors in the general population of 13 municipalities of the middle and upper Val Venosta in South Tyrol.. The CHRIS study successfully recruited 13,393 participants, who underwent biochemical parameter assessments, interviews and clinical investigations on specific fields. Thanks to blood and urine sample biobanking and the increasing number of scientific collaborations that are being established around the study.. Using the biobank the amount of biochemical data per participant have been substantially expanded and now includes whole-genome genotyping (n=13,393), whole-exome sequencing (n=3,422), mitochondrial DNA copy number (n=10,518), lipidomic data (n=7,000) and additional biochemical parameters.
Sample Access Description: Access to the bioresources is regulated through an access regulation for internal and external use and by a data and samples access committee (DAC).
Data Access Description: Data are accessible by scientific research partners or consortia of which Eurac Research is a partner, through ad hoc data and/or sample transfer agreements (DTAs and MTAs) or through ad hoc consortium agreements that establish the type of project and the limits of data access, as well as rules for minimizing data use. The Research Partners undertake to follow the indications of the GDPR and of the Italian interpretation and relative amendments where they differ from and supplement the GDPR as provided for example in Art. 89.
Biobank Label: Cooperative Health Research in South Tyrol Study Biobank

Name: Alport syndrome collection
Description: this section contain patients affected by Alport syndrome. ATS is a rare hereditary nephropathy often associated with sensorineural hypoacusis and ocular abnormalities, with considerable phenotypic variability and different transmission patterns, including monogenic (X-linked/autosomal dominant or recessive) and digenic inheritance. ATS accounts for 1-2% of all patients who start renal replacement therapy in Europe with an estimated frequency of about 1 in 5,000 (Wing A et al. 1989 Jais JP et al. 2000). The avaibility of a large number of patients is potentially important for the clarification of the molecular bases of cases without a mutation in the canonical genes (COL4A4 COL4A3 and COL4A5)
Sample Access Description: -Go to the web site  http://biobanknetwork.telethon.it. . - Select register on the upper right corner.. . - fill in the form fields (mandatory) and then confirm the registration. Once you receive username and password you can log in and place your request:. . . . - Select New sample request in the Management Menu (red section on the right).. . - You will be redirected to a page where you will have to indicate title granting agency and Grant number (if you have e funded project otherwise you can write no grant) and a brief description of the research project for which the sample/samples will be employed. At the end of the description you have to add the following sentence to specify the samples you need:  I request xxxxx from patients with xxxxxxxxx. The samples are present in the Biobank in Siena directed by Prof. Alessandra Renieri

Description: The LTTA Biobank has a collection of cryopreserved samples obtained from over 400 B-CLL patients with different clinical history, collected at the time of diagnosis and / or at subsequent stages of the disease. The cells of leukemia patients, subject to the approval of the Ethics Committee and informed consent of the patients, are isolated from the blood and characterized from a phenotypic and functional point of view. Later they are also frozen (cryopreserved) in conditions that maintain their viability.
Sample Access Description: For users that need to request samples, it is necessary to fill in the request form for biological material on the biobank website. A special commission will decide whether to approve the request.
Data Access Description: For users that need to request data, it is necessary to contact the Biobank referent. A special commission will decide whether to approve the request.
Biobank Label: Biobanca LTTA Laboratorio per le Tecnologie delle Terapie Avanzate

Name: Biological samples from oncological, cardiological and neurological patients
Description: The BB-SDN provides biological samples (serum and plamsa) from patients affected by oncological, cardiological and neurological diseases.

Name: COVID-19
Description: Prospective collection of COVID19 serum and plasma samples

Name: COVID19 Vaccinated Prospective Collection
Description: The present collection is composed by healthcare personnel working at the SDN institute of Naples. People included in this collection were vaccinated with Pfizer Biontech bnt162b2 and prospectively followed after the first and second vaccine administration.

Name: Collezione COVID-19
Description: The collection includes biological samples (blood, serum, plasma etc) from convalescent patients tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 infection with different degrees of severity.

Name: Biobanca Tessuti e Liquidi Biologici IRE
Description: La BBIRE è una biobanca di patologia che raccoglie in qualità campioni oncologici strategici per la ricerca e sviluppo di nuovi biomarcatori per la medicina personalizzata, istituita con lo scopo di conservare e distribuire tessuti e liquidi biologici umani (sangue, siero, plasma, PBMCs, etc.) con i dati a essi associati, al fine di implementare la ricerca oncologica di base, clinica e traslazionale.

Name: Healthy Control Collection
Description: CCPP Biobank collect biological samples such as plasma, serum, PBMCs, DNA and whole blood, from helth subjects after several neuropsychological and neurological assessment.
Sample Access Description: The biological samples are stored at low temperature inside a controlled and registrared cryogenic room, where the access is reserved for trained and authorized biobank personnel only.. . Furthermore, for every access inside a cryogenic room, the authorized personnel biobank must wear specific Personal Protective Equipment.
Data Access Description: Only CCPP Biobank personnel have access to biobank database, by user credentials, where clinical data of the subjects are stored.

Name: Alzheimer Disease Collection
Description: CCPP Biobank collect biological samples such as plasma, serum, PBMCs, DNA and whole blood, from subjects affected by Alzheimer disease at different time points.
Sample Access Description: Only CCPP Biobank personnel have access to cryogenic room where biological samples are stored.
Data Access Description: Only CCPP Biobank personnel have access to biobank database, by user credentials, where clinical data of the subjects are stored.

Name: Mild Cognitive Impairment Collection
Description: CCPP Biobank collect biological samples such as plasma, serum, PBMCs, DNA and whole blood, from subjects affected by Mild cognitive impairment (MCI)  at different time points. MCI causes a slight but noticeable and measurable decline in cognitive abilities, including memory and thinking skills. A person with MCI is at an increased risk of developing Alzheimer's or another dementia.
Sample Access Description: Only CCPP Biobank personnel have access to cryogenic room where biological samples are stored.
Data Access Description: Only CCPP Biobank personnel have access to biobank database, by user credentials, where clinical data of the subjects are stored.

Name: Parkinson Disease Collection
Description: CCPP Biobank collect biological samples such as plasma, serum, PBMCs, DNA and whole blood, from subjects affected by Parkinson Disease at different time points.
Sample Access Description: Only CCPP Biobank personnel have access to cryogenic room where biological samples are stored.
Data Access Description: Only CCPP Biobank personnel have access to biobank database, by user credentials, where clinical data of the subjects are stored.

Name: Parkinsonism Collection
Description: CCPP Biobank collect biological samples such as plasma, serum, PBMCs, DNA and whole blood, from subjects affected by Parkinsonism at different time points. These other neurodegenerative conditions are sometimes grouped together under term of “atypical parkinsonism” or “parkinson-plus syndromes”.  They do not respond as well to  dopaminergic treatments and generally have a worse prognosis compared to typical Parkinson’s disease.   Degenerative causes of parkinsonism may be difficult to diagnose in the earliest stages and ancillary investigations may be of limited value in this instance. CCPP Biobank as Parkinsonism have collected Multiple System Atrophy (MSA), Wilson Disease (WD) and Vascular parkinsonism (VP).
Sample Access Description: Only CCPP Biobank personnel have access to cryogenic room where biological samples are stored.
Data Access Description: Only CCPP Biobank personnel have access to biobank database, by user credentials, where clinical data of the subjects are stored.

Name: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis Collection
Description: CCPP Biobank collect biological samples such as plasma, serum, PBMCs, DNA and whole blood, from subjects affected by Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) disease at different time points.
Sample Access Description: Only CCPP Biobank personnel have access to cryogenic room where biological samples are stored.
Data Access Description: Only CCPP Biobank personnel have access to biobank database, by user credentials, where clinical data of the subjects are stored.

Name: Primary Lateral Sclerosis Collection
Description: CCPP Biobank collect biological samples such as plasma, serum, PBMCs, DNA and whole blood, from subjects affected by Primary Lateral Sclerosis disease (PLS) at different time points.. PLS is a type of motor neuron disease that causes nerves within the brain to slowly break down. This makes the nerves unable to activate the motor neurons in the spinal cord, which control muscles..
Sample Access Description: Only CCPP Biobank personnel have access to cryogenic room where biological samples are stored.
Data Access Description: Only CCPP Biobank personnel have access to biobank database, by user credentials, where clinical data of the subjects are stored.

Name: Myotonic Dystrophy Collection
Description: CCPP Biobank collect biological samples such as plasma, serum, PBMCs, DNA and whole blood, from subjects affected by Myotonic Dystrophy disease type 1 and type 2 (DM1 and DM2). Myotonic dystrophy is part of a group of inherited disorders called muscular dystrophies. It is the most common form of muscular dystrophy that begins in adulthood. Myotonic dystrophy is characterized by progressive muscle wasting and weakness
Sample Access Description: Only CCPP Biobank personnel have access to cryogenic room where biological samples are stored.
Data Access Description: Only CCPP Biobank personnel have access to biobank database, by user credentials, where clinical data of the subjects are stored.

Name: Peripheral Neuropathy Collection
Description: CCPP Biobank collect biological samples such as plasma, serum, PBMCs, DNA and whole blood, from subjects affected by Peripheral Neuropathy such as Guillain-Barré syndrome (GBS),. Miller-Fisher syndrome (MFS), chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy (CIDP), anti- MAG neuropathy and motor multifocal neuropathy (MMN).
Sample Access Description: Only CCPP Biobank personnel have access to cryogenic room where biological samples are stored.
Data Access Description: Only CCPP Biobank personnel have access to biobank database, by user credentials, where clinical data of the subjects are stored

Name: IGB Collection
Description: The Biological Resources Center of the IGB (CRB-IGB) aims to coordinate the biobanking activities of the IGB developed as part of research projects that involve the collection of collections of biological samples.. The CRB-IGB is a core facility and an important resource in the field of biomedical research, from the basic to the translational one, from the understanding of the ethio-pathogenetic mechanisms, of the prognostic / predictive factors, and of the diagnostic parameters, up to the susceptibility to therapy.. The CRB-IGB guarantees interoperability criteria of the individual participating collections by making the procedures for the collection, processing and storage of human biological materials homogeneous and functional, and standardizing both the methods of collecting and storing molecular, physiological, structural information and the related bioinformatics..
Sample Access Description: Presentation of a project, approval of the board of directors, approval of the requesting territorial ethics committee, subscription to an MTA
Data Access Description: Presentation of a project, approval of the board of directors, approval of the requesting territorial ethics committee, subscription to an DTA
Biobank Label: Centro Risorse Biologiche-Istituto di Genetica e Biofisica CNR
